boardgamehonor: 2012 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee
2012 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Winner
128001.description:
Through the Arabian Nights!

Hunting for precious treasures, four princes race across the sky of the Arabian nights on their flying carpets. But watch out for the air pockets! The turbulent night skies can easily bring the princes off course. Who will be the most adept at avoiding the air pockets and be the first to collect all the treasures?


Four Princes find a bunch of magic flying carpets and start an adventurous race throughout the arabian night skies!

As a player you choose one of the Princes on carpets and set of for a quest of finding treasures:
By choosing and rotating arrow-card you navigate your Prince across the tilted magnetic board and thus try to reach the Cloud-Castles, in which the different treasures can be found. But be careful: In some spaces you might encounter air holes - your prince "falls": the token slides down the board! A new flight path must be planned.

The game provides a high replayability, for the board can be tilted in four ways - four different layouts of possible air tracks!

As a player you can either just fly around, which enables even young players to take part, or you can try to spoil the other players' paths by pushing them out of your way - and onto the next air hole.

A great fun for players of all ages!
128001.name: Rally Fally

rpg: Fate of the Norns (Runic Game System)
128002.name: Fate of the Norns: Ragnarok
128002.description:
from the first page of the book

The Twilight of the gods nears,
Brother will kill brother,
Families sundered by incest,
Four ages afoot,
An Axe Age, A Sword Age,
Where shields are cloven,
A Wind Age, A Wolf Age,
Where the world falls,
No one shall be spared...

Game Description by author
Fate of the Norns: Ragnarok is a high fantasy RPG set during the Viking end of days. Fimbulwinter has descended upon Midgard and the world tree is plunged into chaos. Four ages will play out, with players guiding the destiny that was preordained by the Norns. FOTN:R uses the Runic Game System (RGS) that replaces the need for dice. Instead the Futhark set of runes are used to determine the success and failure of actions. FOTN:R continues to build on the rich traditions of its predecessors by adding to and elaborating on the FOTN Mythos.

128003.description:
Objective: flip most of your pearls into opponents area
- acting by turn/2 players or 2 teams -
create 2 equal areas;
each player flips a pearl (of 10) into opponent's area (crossing own area);
move a pearl only once, but bumping (like curling) to optimize position is allowed; pearls outside the 2 areas are out of game.

remarks: Tabaluga is a cartoon character created by Peter Maffay, Rolf Zuckowski, Gregor Rottschalk, Helme Heine
128003.name: Tabaluga: Die Eisperlen

128004.name: Wuselpicknick Das clevere Umweltspiel
128004.description:
Objective: be the first distributing your invitations and solving your quests
- acting by turn -
draw your quest cards first;
throw the die - move fore- or backwards (if there isn't any obstacle like a garbage bin);
ending on a marked space perform required action in order to get rid of one of your quests/invitation card

128005.name: First Contact
128005.description:
From Introduction:

The signal arrived and shook the world. Proof of extraterrestrial intelligence! It was a simple code, easily deciphered and translated.

WE ACKNOWLEDGE AND CONGRATULATE YOU.
MEET US at PARADISE.

This was followed by coordinates to a previously unknown iceball of a world in the backwaters of the Solar System. Now the Interplanetary Exploration Vehicle Carl Sagan is making its final approach to a distant planetoid named Paradise. The Sagan’s main computer, the hyperintelligent nervous system for the mission, has been making mistakes lately. After the boredom and repetition of a long journey, and turning over in their minds the endless possibilities of what they might soon discover, some of the crew are about to crack.

It’s the most important day in history. Humankind balances on the edge of cosmic enlightenment and oblivion.

128006.name: Minion Master
128006.description:
Minion Master is the premier title from BitFlip Games that seamlessly combines elements of tabletop gaming, turn based and real-time strategy, and collectible card building games

Minion Master is a Digital Board game that brings together the moment-to-moment tactics of collectible card games with the long-term strategy of miniature war gaming. Players control armies of figurines on a hex-based board and summon their Minions using a custom built deck of cards. Minion Master will boast a Deck Builder, 6 player co-op and versus multiplayer, a Level Editor, and a constantly expanding universe of Minions to control. Players who pre-order get instant access to the game's Alpha and Beta phases. Inspired by physical RPG board and card games whilst simultaneously adding in elements that are only possible in a virtual world, Minion Master is slated for release on PC this fall.

Source: The Game Website.

128007.name: Chicken
128007.description:
A press-your-luck game for two to four fearless poultry fans

by Shawn Storie and Jonathan A. Leistiko

Object: Draw as many points as you can without drawing more than one chicken foot.

You Need:

A __Chicken__ deck (available on the website)
A way to keep score (ex: paper and pencil)




Each round is divided into two phases: Bid (you bid how many cards you will draw from the deck — highest bid wins) and Draw (winner of the bid has to draw what he or she bid).

When drawing, the drawing player gets to keep any number cards he or she drew face down in front of them. If he or she draws any Chicken Feet, the chicken feet must go face up in front of the player.

At the end of the round, the drawing player tallies his or her score. If the player had no chicken feet, the player gets the sum of the points in front of him/her. If the drawing player had one chicken foot, he or she will add an extra 10 points to his/her score. Two or more chicken feet? The player subtracts the points in front of him/her from his/her score.

If a round ends and at least one player has 50 points or more, the game ends. The player with the most points wins. If any players are tied, play another round with all players.

128008.description: Battle for Normandy OBs, special rules and Scenarios for company level actions, specifically for the "I Ain't Been Shot Mum!" rules.
128008.name: Battle for Liberation

128009.name: Dark Roads & Golden Hells: Planar Options for the Pathfinder RPG
128009.description:
back cover

The Outer Planes Beckon

There are more lands beyond the world than anyone can dream: Worlds of perfect clockwork order, and worlds of roiling chaos. Planes that embody love, war, solitude, and second chances -- where memories cluster in bleak, dark eddies and stories have the power of gods.

Visit the bright realms of Elfland and the dark courts of the shardow fey. Barter for lost souls in Mammon's Golden Court. Question the clockwork oracles of the Gear Plane - but step lively to avoid being ground between its cogs! Scrounge forbidden lore in the tesseract realm of the derro Mother of Madness.

* 14 new planes including the Loom, the Eleven Hells, and the City of Vultures Beyond.

* 6 new planar monsters including the fate-eater, rust drake and spinning hag

* 3 new player character races: the Deva, Maxim and Warplings

* Dozens of bizarre and deadly planar hazards

* Infinite possiblities!

128010.name: Your Whispering Homunculus
128010.description:
from the back cover

Your Whispering Homonculus

A twisted creature hops onto your desk; the homunculi is grotesque, a vile leathery thing of insect and rat and slime topped with a doll's face. It hops onto your shoulder and whispers in an ear, "But master, what happens if..."

Hello, Game Master! Ignore the dollar amount printed on this book, for it is literally priceless.

For starts, author Richard Pett has made each copy by hand, mixing a paste out of dead flakes of his own skin and the rheum from his watery eyes (betraying his Innsmouth heritage), and pressing it into pages that he then inscribes with a pen made from the quill of the Dire Porcupine and the ink of the Dread Squid. No two volumes are alike.

Ah, but the ideas within its pages...that is where this book's true value lies. Peruse its contents and your players will soon find themselves in a world of whimsy, terror, and madness as they:
* Must accept a dare to kiss a diseased cow on its oozing, boil-plagued lips.
* Are driven out of town for ordering roast chicken during the feast of the Staggering Crow
* Encounter a goblin king who is covered in goose fat, collects cat tails, and rolls around in an imaginary barrel
* Choke down a meal of stewed dormice with greengage jam
* Recoil at the taint of the Troll-Touched

Intrigued? Then make your way to the cash register, and demand that the Game Store Knave ring up your purchase. Soon you shall have your very own Whispering Homunculus!

128011.description:
Extra! Extra! is all about completing the front and back pages of a newspaper, with a mixture of stories of different sizes. The larger the story, the better. Players score bonus points for stories in their speciality, extra material, interviews, and headlines.

In the game, players collect news in six newsworthy subjects: home, world, business, politics, sport, and leisure. To do this, they place their reporters on the news they want to publish, but they can be outbid by other newspaper owners with bigger wallets. Copy and photo cuttings can be obtained from "the morgue"; more reporters can be hired; and news sold to raise capital.

Whoever completes his front and back pages first receives a bonus — but will that player have enough Circulation Points to win?
128011.name: Extra! Extra!

128012.name: Crazy Cat Fanciers
128012.description:
A game for two to four pet aficionados.

Goal: - End the game with cats. Lots of cats. Cats that match your personal quirks (youʼre not crazy — just different) are especially nice to have. Donʼt let the feral cat population get to high or youʼll attract the attention of the ASPCA, and you donʼt want that.

You need:
A six-sided die. One die per player is good.
A City deck - this where the cats come from (available on the game's website)
A Thumb-Servants deck - This is where food-bringing servants with opposable thumbs find gifts to bring as offerings to their feline masters (available on the game's website)
Cat Fancier cards - These cards describe the cat fancier youʼre playing in the game(available on the game's website)
Crazy cards - These you what kind of crazy you are. You may have a thing for psycho kitties, lazy fuzzlewumps, or whatever.(available on the game's website)

Each turn begins by determining turn order — the player with the fewest cats goes first in each phase. The players then check to see how hungry the cats are (cats can either be sated, hungry, or famished). Cards from the City deck are then dealt out to the middle of the table. Each player, starting with the first player, then has the opportunity to feed cats, including cats on the table, cats in the Wild that were allowed to go feral in previous turns, cats that are in their household, or other people's cats (which gives them the opportunity to steal those cats). Each player then draws from the Thumb-Servants deck, drawing and keeping cards based on each player's Cat Fancier card. Then the players check to see which cats are hungry, deciding whether to call the ASPCA to pick up the hungry cats (which also may cause the player to lose other cats) or allow the cats to go feral, placing them in the Wild on the table.

The game ends when one or more players has 10 or more cats or if the City deck runs out of cards.

Points are then scored based on the number of cats each player has and any bonuses they may have received from Crazy Cat cards and Cat Fancier cards. However, if the City deck runs out, the ASPCA may come and get everyone's cats - if this happens, everyone loses!

128013.name: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 1: Episode 2: Starved For Help
videogameseries: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series
videogamecompilation: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - The Complete First Season
128013.description:
With starvation and bandit attacks as much of a threat as the undead, you will learn what you’re willing to resort to in order to survive. As things become ever more desperate, the group is offered food from strangers, but at what cost?

Source: The Game Website.

128014.name: Hidden Rules
128014.description:
A game for three or more secret-keeping rule enforcers.

Each player gets a secret rule at the start of the game. All rules are in play – including the ones you don’t know. It’s up to the person who has the rule to enforce it or not. Your goal is to be the first player to accumulate 3 points. The best way to do this is by learning the secret rules of the game faster than the other players and taking tricks.

You Need:
A standard Poker deck (Jokers removed)
A Hidden Rules trigger deck (available on the game's website)
A Hidden Rules action deck (available on the game's website)
Paper and pencil to track scores (optional, but recommended)

The basic game is played in tricks. The dealer begins the first trick of the game; after that, each trick begins when the last player to take a trick takes the top card of the deck, places it face-up on the table, and announces its value. Starting with the player to his or her left, and proceeding clockwise, each player must play a card from his or her hand on the trick, calculate the sum of all cards in the trick, and announce the sum.

Card Values: 2 through 10 are worth their face value. Aces are worth 1 or 11 (declared when played). Jacks are worth 0 points, Queens are worth -2 points, and Kings are worth -4 points.

If the sum is less than 21, play continues normally. If you bring the sum to exactly 21, you take the trick. If you push the sum over 21, the player to your right takes the trick, for forcing you to exceed 21. When you take a trick, add one to your score, and gather the cards from the trick into a pile face-down in front of you. Once taken, the cards from a trick may not be looked at.

All hidden rules are also in play. Each combination of a trigger and an action is a rule. It’s up to you to enforce (or not) a rule that you know about. When you enforce a rule, you must give the person information to indicate in what way their action violated the rule. The information you provide must be more specific than the violation. If you violate a rule, take back the card you played (if applicable), lose a point, and your turn ends (if it’s your turn).

For example, trigger #13 says, “When you play a card that makes the total exactly zero…” and action #5 says, “…Name a Peanuts character that hasn’t been named previously this game before you announce the sum of the trick.” If I make the total 0 and don’t say anything, you can make me take back my card and say, “You didn’t say a name.” The next time I make the total 0, If I say, “Neil Armstrong,” you can correct me again and say, “Neil Armstrong isn’t fictional.”

The first player to end a round with 3 or more points more wins.

This game owes a lot to the children’s “folk game” Mao.

128015.name: Birthday Party, Cheesecake, Jelly Bean, Boom!
128015.description:
A very, very lightweight trick-taking game for three to six R.E.M. fans.

Goal: End the game with the most points. Do this by being the last player to play on a trick. Look out for Boom! cards – they’ll make all the points go away!

You Need:


A Birthday Party, Cheesecake, Jellybean, Boom! (BPCCJBB) deck (available on the game's website)


If you’re starting a trick, you must play a Birthday Party. If you can not start with a Birthday Party, show your hand to the player on your right or left and let play pass to the next player, who must start the trick.

On your turn you may play a card or pass. If you pass on a trick you may still play later on the same trick.

If you want to play a card, look at the top card of the trick:


If the top card is a Birthday Party, you may play a Birthday Party or a Cheesecake.
If the top card is a Cheesecake, you may play a Cheesecake or a Jelly Bean.
If the top card is a Jelly Bean, you may play a Jelly Bean or you may play a Boom! and set all the cards in the trick aside, out of play.


If you run out of cards, immediately draw up to five cards. If the deck runs out of cards, it’s out of cards. No cards for you!

If you play on a trick and play comes all the way around to you and no one else has played on the trick, you take the trick. Put all of the cards in the trick in your score pile.

When you take a trick or Boom! a trick, you must start the next trick.

If it’s the end of a trick and the deck is out of cards, the game is over. Put any cards in your hand in the score pile of the player on your right.

Winning: Sum the points on the cards in your score pile. If you have the most points, you win!

128016.name: Whizz Bing Bang
128016.description:
In Whizz Bing Bang, a quick card game for 3 to 6 players, players take turns reading the top card of the deck, with the word on that card dictating how gameplay will continue:


Whizz: Game play continues in the same direction.
Bing: Game play reverses direction.
Bang: Game play continues in the same direction, but skips the next player.
Boom: Everyone must slap and leave their hand on the Boom while saying "BOOM!".


Penalties for playing out of order, slapping the deck when no Boom was played, being last to hit the Boom card, playing too slowly, etc. are distributed in the form of tokens, with players starting with one face-down token for each sound: Whizz, Bing, Bang, Boom (ordered low to high). The player who is first to hit the Boom card gives a token to the player who hit it last, but in all other penalty situations, players must race to find the lowest face-down token they hold and give it to the penalized player face up; whoever does so first gives the token away while all other players keep theirs and reshuffle them. When one player gives his Boom token away, each player scores one point for each token he holds. When a player has scored 15 or more points, the game ends and the player with the fewest points wins.

128017.name: Badass Space Marines
128017.description:
From the introduction:

This is a roleplaying game that is designed to be run with no preparation in a single game of two to four hours. It is inspired by the cinematic soldiers versus aliens genre – that means Aliens above all else.

Every game session has the same basic setup – a squad of marines is heading out to investigate an isolated colony (or where ever). Contact has been lost and Colonial Defense is suspicious. Inevitably, there's a hostile force waiting there and it's up to you guys to save the day or die trying. And do it with style.

To make each game different, the mystery is invented as you go along. All players get an equal say in what actually occurred.

128018.name: Striiv
videogamehwmfg: Jiang Tian Chong Chin Technology Co., Ltd
128018.description:
User Summary
Striiv is a pedometer with three racing games and one land creation game. Points for the games are earned through physical movement.

128019.name: The King of Fighters-i 2012
128019.description:
User Summary

The 2012 iteration of SNK's King of Fighter-i. The 2012 version, although still part of Ash Crimson's story arc and still using the same engine as the previous version, packs a challenge mode, more collectibles, unlockable stages and most importantly, more fighters.

Among others, new fighters include Ikari Warriors, Leona, Ralf & Clark, Art of Fighting characters, Ryo, Robert and Takuma, as well as idol and Psycho Soldier, Athena Asamiya.

128020.name: Granado Espada
128020.description:
User Summary

A free to play MMO developed by HanbitSoft, Granado Espada is best known for its beautiful graphics and art style, as well as its unique gameplay where players control up to 3 characters at a time.

Unique to Granado Espada is the game's AFK feature, where players can leave their characters to fight monsters despite being away. Players are also free to switch between teams of 3, and level different characters and classes. Also featured in the game is the ability to recruit NPC characters, dubbed as Unique Player Characters or UPCs. Such UPCs pack exclusive skills, specialized stats and even unique fighting styles or stances. Granado Espada's initial released featured timed spawns and world bosses but subsequent releases finally introduced timer instances in order to reduce player monopoly and camping.

Granado Espada was released by Reloaded Games through their Gamersfirst label in the United States under the title Sword of the New World, but was later renamed to Sword 2.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee
128021.description:
Twiga the giraffe and her friends are surprised as all of their brown spots have disappeared and been replaced by spots of various colors and shapes. Is it the mysterious spot disease?

In Twiga, each player has four giraffe cards representing the various parts of his body. By drawing wooden shapes from a bag, players help their giraffe find its real spots; they appear thanks to magic transparent cards. The first player to recover all of his giraffe's spots wins the game!
128021.name: Twiga

128022.name: Tabaluga: Das Drachenbergrennen
128022.description:
Objective: score most winning points climbing up the hill (Drachenberg) with your team of 3 (coloured) meeples
- moving by turn -
roll the die & make up your mind who of your team should move forward; up to your choice: step out, jump or kick out on your way to the top - collecting winning points by adding the position of all your meeples;
game ends after one figure has reached the peak.

128023.name: Ruiny
128023.description:
Publisher's blurp:

Ruiny to szesnasty dodatek w serii Neuroshimy. Jego tematem są opuszczone budowle, gruzowiska, zawalone wieżowce i wszystko co się z nimi łączy.

Translation:

"Ruiny" is 16th sourcebook for the role playing game Neuroshima. You will find there all about abandoned buildings, debris, collapsed skyscrapers and everything associated with them.

128024.name: Rahja-Vademecum
128024.description:
(user summary)
A manual that provides all the information players need to add background and depth to their clerics of Rahja, Goddess of love and joy. It includes prayers, canticles, rituals, holy books, and other background information on the cults of Rahja.

128025.name: Tabaluga Die eisige Aufgabe
128025.description:
Objective: be the first rendering ice maker machines harmless
- acting by turn -
use 2 coloured dice to block (evil) ice maker machines;
very similar (risky) concept like 'Can't Stop' moving your markers to the top; if you save your current position ==> new starting points during your next turn; if you fail you loose what you'd accomplished during your current turn.

remarks:
belongs to Schmidt series: 'Nimm-mich-mit-Spiele'

128026.name: Tabaluga: Auf der Suche nach den Weltraumsteinen
128026.description:
Objective: Find your (coloured) 2 (correspondent) slides (memory) and move your meeple upon to gather them; move further to your (coloured) target space ending the game.
- acting/moving by turn -
Each player throws the die moving forward & uncovering 2 slides:
wrong colour ==> flip them again; right: try (during your following turns) finding the correspondent one. If lucky move upon and grasp it/them (but avoid stepping upon an - additional - quest card, which spoils your further movement).

128027.name: Men of War: Condemned Heroes
videogameexpansion: Men of War
128027.description:
Men of War: Condemned Heroes is the newest installment in the best-selling Men of War series which fuses tactical thinking with the action-packed direct control mode.

Men of War: Condemned Heroes tells the story of one of the infamous Soviet penal battalions during the WWII. These battalions are famous for being formed under Stalin’s “No step back!” order #227. They consisted of court-martialed officers that were given a chance to redeem their crimes, or incompetence, in blood by serving as the lowest enlisted rank in a battalion that was assigned the most dangerous tasks. These battalions’ images are surrounded by many myths, and this game tells the truth about these regiments based on real evidence from their former members.

Take command of one of these notorious companies and lead it to victory against all odds through most of the war on the Eastern front. Fight from desperate battles in 1942 in the area of Volyn in the Ukraine, to the massive operation “Bagration” in the Brest area, Magnush bridgehead and Warsaw area in Poland and finally to attacks on the German Altdam and Stettin near the end of the war.

Source: The Game Website.

128028.description:
CLASH: Jihad vs. McWorld is a two-player logic game. Both players start the game with a set of seven tiles. During the game, they can also use five neutral tiles, randomly selected from a stack of 17, which adds variation to each game. Each tile shows a different Person/Event and has a different power. The players take turns placing tiles on the 3x3 square playing board. Each tile placed will either turn, destroy, or move one or more of the tiles already on the board. Whoever has the most tiles facing in his direction when all nine squares of the board are filled wins.

Reimplements:

RRR
128028.name: CLASH: Jihad vs. McWorld

128029.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Do you have what it takes to enter the arena and battle to the death with the most powerful Mages in the world? Mage Wars combines the best elements of customizable card games and tactical miniatures games to create a unique, fast-paced, strategic fight to the finish!

Mage Wars: Core Spell Tome contains 110 cards that feature additional copies of the most useful spells from the Mage Wars base game. Whether you need an extra "Block", "Dispel", "Pillar of Light", or "Thunderift Falcon", with the Core Spell Tome, you will have the spells you need to vanquish your opponents in the Arena. With this supplement, you have the ability to customize your Mage and explore various builds adding depth to your tactics and assault. You need the Mage Wars base game to use this expansion.
128029.name: Mage Wars: Core Spell Tome 1

128030.name: Shanghai Vampocalypse
128030.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to 2048 and one of the greatest cyberpunk cities in the near-future - Shanghai. The government has infected a hundred villages with a vampire virus to create the perfect super-soldiers, but the peasants revolted and a virus that was supposed to be sterile is spreading with every neck they bite.

Unless the characters can keep the mysterious scientist Doctor Wu alive for twelve hours, Shanghai will be just the first snack on the way to vampire domination of all mankind. Shanghai Vampocalypse is the first setting book for characters who reach the new Demigod rank Suzerain introduced to Savage Worlds.

Because one vampire is a challenge, but eight million are an apocalypse... and a suitable challenge for demigods!

Product contains: A full color 148 page PDF including...

All the knowledge you'll need to run games in Shanghai 2048.
Many new character options including new Edges, Hindrances and Powers.
Rules for turbo-charging characters to play the campaign instantly, including hooks into the ancient local gods like Dragon of the Bund and Crane on Mountaintop.
Ancient mystical magic meets cybertech - all manner of supernatural martial arts and high tech equipment explained in detail.
30 scenarios including a full plot-point campaign taking characters through Demigod rank all the way up to godhood!

128031.name: Shanghai Vampocalypse Player's Guide
128031.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to 2048 and one of the greatest cyberpunk cities in the near-future - Shanghai. The government has infected a hundred villages with a vampire virus to create the perfect super-soldiers, but the peasants revolted and a virus that was supposed to be sterile is spreading with every neck they bite.

Unless the characters can keep the mysterious scientist Doctor Wu alive for twelve hours, Shanghai will be just the first snack on the way to vampire domination of all mankind. Shanghai Vampocalypse is the first setting book for characters who reach the new Demigod rank Suzerain introduced to Savage Worlds.

Because one vampire is a challenge, but eight million are an apocalypse... and a suitable challenge for demigods!

Product contains: A full color 35 page PDF including...

All the knowledge you'll need to create and play characters in Shanghai 2048.
Many new character options including new Edges, Hindrances and Powers.
Rules for turbo-charging characters to play the campaign instantly, including hooks into the ancient local gods like Dragon of the Bund and Crane on Mountaintop.
Ancient mystical magic meets cybertech - all manner of supernatural martial arts and high tech equipment explained in detail.

128032.name: Caladon Falls Player’s Guide
128032.description:
From publisher blurb:

They came out of nowhere and started ripping the world apart, one city at a time. Using power on a scale never before seen, Warlocks, god-like leaders of the Wild army, are rampaging across Austeria with one goal: raise armies and annihilate the entire continent. Set in the fantasy realm of Relic, this book looks at warfare through the eyes of everyday people turned soldiers - soldiers whose side is losing the war.

Take the challenge and roleplay in a fantasy world where enchanters and druids rub shoulders with nobles, knights, mercenaries, and holy crusaders. Focus on a daily life and death struggle where the enemy is cruel, powerful, and around every corner. Take the challenge, and let your adventurers become...

...Caladon's only hope.

Product Contains: A 46 page PDF. This is a high art product and a large download. When you buy this PDF you also get a print friendly version at no extra cost. Inside the covers you'll find:

Heaps of world detail you'll need to make characters in the Suzerain realm of Relic during the War of the Wild.
Many new Edges, Hindrances, and Powers, including three new playable races and Pulse Paths.
A detailed map of the High Kingdom Of Caladon.

128033.name: Lamentations of the Flame Princess Perk (IndieGoGo PDF Reward)
128033.description:
User Summary:

One of the reward options for supporting the IndieGoGo campaign for This Just In... From Gen Con 2012.

The PDF contains an essay (Why Use Monsters?) and four campaign-exclusive monsters (Thought Creeper, The Deliverer of Slugs, Serpent of Deadly Knowledge, and The Time Fucker) for your Lamentations of the Flame Princess campaign.

128034.description:
Munchkin Naughty & Nice, the fourth Christmas-themed Munchkin booster pack, contains 15 non-randomized cards. Now players can use the "Candy Cane" and "Tannenbomb" to fight off the "Snow Angels" and "Holiday Spirits"! "Spike the Egg Nog" to Go Up a Level! Be "Naughty" or "Nice"...or both at once!

The "Naughty" and "Nice" cards have the same text, but different artwork, as the same-named cards in the original Munchkin: Waiting For Santa (which is currently out of print).

Part of the Munchkin series.
128034.name: Munchkin Naughty & Nice

128035.name: Noir Knights Player's Guide
128035.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is PDF product includes the first (player's) section of the full Noir Knights book. It's for players who don't want to read all the GMs secrets and the campaign scenarios.

This Savage realm of Suzerain is the tale of the 1930s Great Depression as you've never experienced it. For Heroic rank characters who are feeling particularly heroic, Noir Knights is part of our American Grit realm, where government agents investigate paranormal activity across a hard boiled film noir America.

Whether it's a supernatural swampland encounter in Florida or otherworldly conspiracies in the corridors of power, the truth is out there - just waiting for your characters to find it. Industry and legend clash in a time of folk heroes, hobo mages, and secret societies.

America is a nation of dust and determination.
Ride the rails and prove your mettle.

Product contains: A full color 36 page PDF including...


Everything you'll need to run games in a supernatural 1930s.
Many new character options including new Edges, Hindrances and Powers.
Weather-manipulating wizards, taxidermist reanimating priests, and railwalker hobo magic users - all as playable options!
All the possibilities of the X-Files with femmes fatales and four-color G-men thrown in.

128036.description:
Objective: be the first gathering 5 coloured slides

35 slides (each with 3 different rainbow colours) are distibuted on the table;
active player throws 3 dice (each with 6 different colours)
all players try to find/grasping the matching slide, first one may keep it;
But be aware - already gathered slides may be a target during next rounds!
128036.name: Tabaluga: Der Regenbogenschatz

128037.name: The Best Little Hellhouse in Texas
128037.description:
From publisher blurb:

There's a fortune to be dug up, out on the frontier… as long as you survive!

Welcome to a gunslinging adventure set in the supernatural Old World, where tough-as-nails preachers hold back the horrors scuttling into town with the power of their prayers while mad tinkerers and potionographers create gadgets and lotions, gizmos and tinctures for lawmen and bandits alike.

Inside this book you'll find details on a whole continent of the Untamed Empires, a story for characters of 175 Karma value, hooks for further adventures, and another 75 feats for the Suzerain rules system… adding a whole wagon-load of options to your characters!

128038.name: Bitter Fumes
128038.description:
From publisher blurb:

So you are a fantasy fan and a Suzerain fan? Welcome to Relic. Welcome home. This adventure toolkit is the start of something beautiful and we hope you enjoy every second of it.

You reckon wizardry stinks? Just wait till you take in the Fumes!

The alchemists and anatomists are on the brink of a wizard war in New Garris. The alleyways of the Fumes are a powder keg, and then someone throws in a match

Welcome to the high octance setting for your fantasy game, set in the Suzerain world of Relic.

128039.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Fleet Boxes are designed for use with any game set in the Star Fleet Universe, including A Call to Arms: Star Fleet, Star Fleet Battles, Federation Commander, and Starmada. Each contains enough ships for a complete fleet in these games and will allow players to quickly expand their forces.

This box set contains 16 ships for the Klingon Empire, along with 6 shuttles and a pocket rulebook – all you need to start playing!
- C8 Dreadnought
- D6 Heavy Cruiser x2
- D7 Battlecruiser x2
- C7 Heavy Cruiser x2
- F5 Frigate x3
- D5W Heavy Cruiser
- FD7 Fast Cruiser
- E4 Light Frigate x2
- D5 War Cruiser x2
- Shuttles x6
- Pocket Rulebook
This product is being done as a joint venture with Amarillo Design Bureau, inc., under the strict terms of their contract with Paramount Pictures Corporation.
128039.name: A Call To Arms: Star Fleet – Klingon Fleet Box

128040.name: Blessed Child
128040.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some princesses are blessed at birth with grace, beauty, and good sense. Mari of Tarag-Hih would be so lucky! Instead, she was promised the love of all the gods. When the agents of the besotted deities invade her fairytale realm, it’s up to your band of visiting heroes to make sure everyone leaves happy - from Krona-Yig (the Eyeless Tyrant) to Pele, Hawaiian goddess of volcanoes.

This Heroic rank tale for Savage Worlds is set in the god realms of the Maelstrom. It creates a diplomatic burly brawl, where honor and humanity are as scarce as seven-league boots. Will they fight for what’s right, or for the deific suitor with the deepest pockets? And whatever happened to the Forgotten Forest, anyway?

128041.name: Barbary
128041.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mysterious cluster of islands holds many Ancient secrets and intrigues. Whether it's one of the numerous inhabitants, monsters that hunt in the underwater canyons, or even the sea herself, Barbary offers you plenty of material to keep your players on the edge of their seats.

Included in this set:

Detailed descriptions of Barbary Island and the other islands nearby
Three maps, of the Setward Isles and the Barbary area
Six Untamed Tales, expandable encounters and adventures in the region
A bestiary of 21 new enemies with full creature stats

128042.description:
objective: gather as few as possible of those 'snow-tiles';
- acting/moving by turn -
active player throws the die & moves forward;
if there is no land inside of the race track ==> uncover a slide: Green? ==> place it upon a snowy region; White? ==> keep it (penalty point)
if there is another player and/or green land you end on - nothing happens;
if there is another player with less penalty points: turn over a white (penalty) slide;
game ends if there is 'green' all over inside - player with less penalty slides wins
128042.name: Tabaluga: Rettet Grünland

128043.name: The Guild Companion (July 2012)
128043.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

128044.name: Ace Mathician
128044.description:
"Ace Mathician is a awesome new puzzle game in which the player needs to use math to reach the
exit! The cool thing about Ace Mathician is that there are no wrong answers.

It turns math into a sandbox game!

There are many math games, so what makes this one totally different?

The other math games don’t really incorporate the math into the gameplay. Instead it splits into two parts. One is the game, the second is the math. For example, the player walks up to a door, the game prompts him with a math sum and he needs to answer correctly if he wants to open the door.

If the player does not know the answer he is stuck.

It also does not really make math fun. Instead it’s more like a parent letting you play a videogame AFTER you make your homework.

Ace Mathician takes a complete different approach. It let’s the player create and shape with math!
There are no right or wrong answers! On top of that it helps the player visualize the math, which works
much better as a learning tool.

Suddenly math becomes as fun as drawing!"

Source: The Game Website.

128045.name: Schwein Gehabt?
128045.description: A simple dice game where You must complete animals (rooster, dog, cow, pig). 5 dices are rolled, each die face shows one half of an animal - front or rear half. When two halves of the same animal are rolled the player is allowed to grab one of the 10 animal tiles from the middle of the table. If two matching halves are shown then 2 tiles, if none show then he cannot do anything. When no appropriate tiles are in stock a player can snatch one from another player. The game ends when only 1 animal tile is left in the stock. Player with most completed animals wins.

128046.name: Argosian Light Hauler
128046.description:
From publisher blurb:

A small commonly used space transport. The Argosian Light Hauler has seen service as a passenger transport, exploring vehicle, and teamster cargo vehicle. Its inexpensiveness and ubiquity make this vehicle easy to maintain and purchase secondhand.

PDF includes:

A seven paged floor plan detailing the Hoplite Frigate.
A detailed look at all three decks
A crew population breakdown including attributes, skills, and statistics
Layered floor plans that allows the user to toggle on and off detail as they wish
Completely compatible with all HELLAS: Worlds of Sun and Stone products

128047.name: Ceto Class Hauler
128047.description:
From publisher blurb:

A large pondrous transport used mostly in the Goregon systems. The ships are large, sturdy and powerful just like their serpentine designers. Made to carry cargo or people the ship is versatile and durable. The ships have been known to remain in service for hundreds of years because of their simple and straightforward design.

The Ceto Class Hauler PDF includes:

A hex grid layer
An eight paged floor plan detailing the Ceto Class Hauler.
A detailed look at all five decks
A crew population breakdown including attributes, skills, and statistics
Layered floor plans that allows the user to toggle on and off detail as they wish

128048.name: Hesperan Cruiser
128048.description:
From publisher blurb:

A sleek, high-speed transport designed by the Amazorans for both military and civilian purposes. The aesthetics have been copied much in the years since its debut and the ship is common is Hesperan space.

The Hesperan Cruiser Class PDF includes:

A hex grid layer
An eight paged floor plan detailing the Ceto Class Hauler.
A detailed look at all five decks
A crew population breakdown including attributes, skills, and statistics
Layered floor plans that allows the user to toggle on and off detail as they wish

128049.name: Sagittarius AE-41
128049.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sagittarius Argosian Engine 41 is a sleek sturdy Argosian merchant transport. The Sagittarius is renowned for its speed and maneuverability and is known as one of the most agile transport ships. The Sagittarius is modified for duties ranging from material and personnel transport to custom ships in poorer systems.

The layered floor plans for one of the most common ships traveling the Slispace lanes of HELLAS: Worlds of Sun and Stone.

PDF includes:

A seven paged floor plan detailing the Sagittarius Argosian Engine 41.
A detailed look at all three decks
A crew population breakdown including attributes, skills, and statistics
Layered floor plans that allows the user to toggle on and off detail as they wish

128050.name: Spartan Destroyer
128050.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the most feared and deadly ships in the Spartan fleet, known in some sectors of space as Areson's Will. The destroyer is built with one thing in mind; to bring down capital ships. The ship carries two pentēkostyai, or 144 Spartan fighting men (for boarding actions), and 3 space fighters.

The Spartan Destroyer PDF includes:

A hex grid layer
An eight paged floor plan detailing the Spartan Destroyer.
A detailed look at all 8 decks
A crew population breakdown including attributes, skills, and statistics
The Statistics for the Spartan Dominator attack craft carried onboard.
Layered floor plans that allows the user to toggle on and off detail as they wish

128051.name: Zoran Gunship
128051.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lion's Roar is a massive Zoran-produced heavy fighter bomber. The large gunship has room to accommodate eight passengers or marines and a Slipspace drive for long-range missions. The Lion's Roar is used by small mercenary groups throughout the known worlds.

The Zoaran Gunship PDF includes:

A hex grid layer
A six paged floor plan detailing the Hoplite Frigate.
A detailed look at all three decks
A crew population breakdown including attributes, skills, and statistics
Layered floor plans that allows the user to toggle on and off detail as they wish
Completely compatible with all HELLAS: Worlds of Sun and Stone products

128052.name: Hoplite Frigate
128052.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sold to many worlds, the frigate is a versatile vessel that can be used as a light interdictor and weapons platform when larger ships are not available...

PDF includes:

An eight paged floor plan detailing the Hoplite Frigate.
A detailed look at all five decks
A crew population breakdown including attributes, skills, and statistics
Layered floor plans that allows the user to toggle on and off detail as they wish

128053.name: Gene Effect
128053.description:
User Summary

Gene Effect is a mining/exploration game set on Mars in the 2060s. The backstory to the game centers around an ancient alien race, the Na'rul. Remnants of Na'rul technology are found on Mars in the 2040s, and soon humans are able to reproduce advanced metal alloys based on a rare ore called koronite. Humans also discover Na'rul jump-gates, and use this technology to explore space and locate valuable resources. In Gene Effect, the player pilots a small mining craft and explores dark caverns filled with exotic and sometimes foreboding vegetation. The goal is to locate and mine several types of ore, depositing it at depots before exiting via jump gate. The craft is sensitive to collisions and other threats, but its nano-hull slowly regenerates. A sonar tool allows players to clear debris such as stalacites, and also to expose hidden ore deposits. On occasion, the craft is equipped with a missle-like "T-drone" as well. Gene Effect scores players performance in numerous categories, including damage to craft, time, ore collected, etc.

128054.name: Seventh Sense
128054.description:
Seventh Sense is a comprehensive game state tracker, with automatic functions built in for combat, random number generation, limiting choices based on equipment/skills/etc. Despite the high level of automation, Seventh Sense retains much of the hands-on feel of reading the paper books. With support for multiple profiles, you can run different campaigns, testing out different combinations of skills or path choices, and you can share the game with family or friends. With many varied options for "house rules", you can customize the playing experience to suit your favorite style, make the game easier or more difficult, earn various in-game awards, or even gain a place in the Hall of Fame!

Source: The Game Website.

128055.name: Astrozombies Must Die!
128055.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’re not making a delivery, you’re saving a delivery. There is another Class D ship out there, with some apparently high profile cargo, that has gone dark on the ass end of the Frontier Zone. What was this all important cargo? What happened to the crew of the previous ship? With a lack of detail to the mission specs, the biggest question is are you coming back?

Astrozombies Must Die! is an adventure scenario for the Bulldogs! role-playing game. All Bulldogs! adventure scenarios contain tips on running adventures for Bulldogs! and other FATE games, as well as full fleshed out NPCs for each level of character power, allowing GMs to use the adventure scenario for their group regardless of current power level. This PDF also includes pre-generated handouts for GMs to use in conjunction with the adventure.

128056.name: Stormy Weather
128056.description:
From publisher blurb:

The planet Yentsin, wholly owned subsidiary of the Ion Mining Company, has a problem. Some of the workers on the planet don’t like how Ion runs things. They’ve started a revolution to try and get Ion to make a few adjustments. Despite the troubles, Ion still needs supplies delivered, and TransGalaxy Class D is the only outfit willing to brave the storms and the rebels. Good luck!

Stormy Weather is an adventure scenario for the Bulldogs! role-playing game. All Bulldogs! adventure scenarios contain tips on running adventures for Bulldogs! and other FATE games, as well as full fleshed out NPCs for each level of character power, allowing GMs to use the adventure scenario for their group regardless of current power level. This PDF also includes pre-generated handouts for GMs to use in conjunction with the adventure.

128057.name: More Things in Heaven and Earth: A Campaign Frame Compilation
128057.description:
From publisher blurb:

Old gods drink themselves to oblivion in a Philadelphia dive bar. A mysterious death and possible theft are the Saint-Germain legacy. In a small Southern town, that which rises will not be put down. Hard-boiled gumshoes investigate magical crimes in the twisted '50s. Soldiers hunt down and destroy horrible elder beings in Project M.A.G.I. Punk rock channels magic stolen from the Devil, live... from New Amsterdam.

This book is a collection of the first nine Mortal Coil campaign frames, plus one additional bonus campaign frame available only in this compilation. A copy of the core Mortal Coil rules is required to use these in your Mortal Coil game.

A campaign frame is a fully sketched out setting in the form of a detailed theme document, with all of the world set-up choices written out in detail. These are designed to be customizable by your game group. Each frame contains options for more than one tone and magic level. You choose a tone and pick the magic level that is appropriate for your game. Players then create characters, or choose one of the characters listed in the campaign frame, and you can begin play immediately.

Campaign frames are great ways to do a quick setup for Mortal Coil, and are ideal for playing a pick-up game or convention game. If your players really like the setting, the frame can be used for a longer term game as well. A campaign frame is also useful as a how-to on setting up a unique theme document of your own.

User note: the campaign frames previously released and included are Divinity, Hag Ride, Old Gods, Project M.A.G.I., The Saint-Germain Legacy, Soul Train, Swords of Astagar, That Which Rises, and Twisted 50s.

128058.name: The Agency (2nd Edition)
rpghonor: 2011 Indie RPG Award - Game of the Year - Runner-Up
128058.description:
From publisher blurb:

1960s London

A world of red telephone boxes, Bentleys, Union Jack waistcoats, velvet jackets, bowler hats, the Beatles, Bobbies, eccentrics, Hippies, the Cold War and miniskirts. All filmed at strange angles and in far too many primary colours.

Never to be considered an accurate portrayal of the period; this is a world where spies can be famous, where an umbrella is a deadly weapon, and where this message will self destruct… This is the world of The Agency; where groovy agents battle sinister supernatural forces.

Featuring:

Eccentric characters with heroic bonuses (and flaws), their own theme music and unexpected gadgets.
Quick and easy game prep and an abstract threat system for easy GMing.
Everything you need to play your own 1960s TV series in style!




Originally published as part of The No Press RPG Anthology, this new revised edition includes streamlined rules, examples of play, scenarios and advice.

128059.name: Planetary Survey: Korinthos
128059.description:
From publisher blurb:

Korinthos is the crossroads of the galaxy, the most important trading center of the Hellenes, and a haven for those seeking to make a profit. It is a planet of banking, merchants, and vice. Covered by a megatropolis known to locals as "The City," there is a planet hidden beneath the towering spires, spreading plazas, and elevated ports. Korinthos has largely been protected as a neutral planet as a great deal of the galaxy's finance is handled here. Alongside the legitimate business, large crime syndicates flourish here. Police and the government regulate traffic entering and leaving, but have little influence down on the streets and so many institutions run their own private security forces.

Included in this PDF is:

A look at the Korinthos system and planetary population
A system wide service and commodities rating
Locations of interest on the planet Korinthos
Planetary statistics
Planetary Metousia rating

128060.name: HELLAS: Wine Dark Void
128060.description:
(Publisher blurb)

Sing to me of the man, Muse, the man of twists and turns, driven time and again off course, once he had plundered the hallowed heights of Troy. Many cities of men he saw and learned their minds, many pains he suffered, heartsick on the open sea, fighting to save his life and bring his comrades home. But he could not save them from disaster, hard as he strove.

-The Odyssey

This is the second major supplement to the original HELLAS Core Rules! With this expansion to the HELLAS Core Rules, you will at last be able to sail the cosmic all sea in search of adventure and glory. Will you be immortalized among the stars?

The 144-page book includes:

Details and full-color illustrations of 40+ ships
Ship modification and construction rules
Slipspace phenomena: an in-depth look into the wine dark void known as the Panthalassa, the cosmic all sea
Slipspace encounters: a detailed look at the strange denizens that ply the slipspace trade routes, preying on the weak
A detailed look at the planet Korinthos, a mega-city sprawl that covers the entire planet
New Metousia rules: a clear look at the players' ability to change the world around them
Planetary Consumer/Trade scores for the major known worlds
A detailed look at the goddess Aionisia and her temple moon
Vehicle space combat and chase rules

128061.description:
The game consists of large flower tiles in which animals are also shown, and matching flower cards. Besides a memory game, other simple rule sets are also supplied. One is like musical chair: The number of flowers in each color is one less than there are players. The players run around the flowers, and when one player calls out a color, the players have to put their hands on the flowers in that color - the player who is last is out. Continue until only one player remains.
In another game, a card is flipped over and all players turn up flowers - a player who finds the matching one can keep it and flip over a new card. The first player who gets three flowers wins.

The components of the game are large and suitable for the outdoors.
128061.name: Buntes Blumen-Rennen

128062.name: Marvel Heroic Roleplaying: Sneak Peak
128062.description:
User Comment

A 4-page PDF excerpt from the Marvel Heroic Roleplaying: Basic Game manual. This PDF is available as a free download from the Margaret Weis Productions, Ltd. website. These 4 pages are the same as pages OM06 through OM09 in the Basic Game manual.

128063.description:
In Uchronia, you are the patriarch of a great Uchronian noble house, competing with the other houses that commit their wealth to building the city, enriching it with new constructions, and striving to win over the people.

In game terms, players start with six resource cards in hand, then each discard a card to the shared forum; each resource card shows the type of resource (with color-coded five resources in the game), an activity icon (with, for example, all yellow clay cards showing a pick), and an order (with yellow showing Production). Five building cards are placed face-up in the Great Works area and can be built by the players; any time a building is taken from this area, reveal another building card.

On a turn, you first move any card(s) played the previous turn to the forum, then you either Command or Plot. To Command, you play one card from your hand with the order you want to carry out or two identical cards, which allows you to take any order. The orders are:


Production: Place one card from the forum into your stock. For each Production activity you have, take the action again.
Exploration: Place one card from your hand into your stock. Repeat for each Exploration activity.
Draconians: Show one card from your hand, then move one card of this type from the forum to your stock; in addition, each player who commanded in his previous turn must give you a card of the same type from his hand, if possible. For each Draconians activity you have, you can show one more card, which lets you claim more from the forum and possibly more from opponents.
Trade: Transform one resource in your stock to an activity. Repeat for each Trade activity.
Construction: Start a new building (by discarding a matching color resource from the forum) or transfer a resource from your stock to a building in progress. Repeat for each Construction activity.


When you complete a building, you gain its special ability for the remainder of the game. You can have only two activities, plus one more for each completed building you own. If you have more of a particular ability than anyone else, you claim the monopoly card for this activity, making each of these activities worth 1 victory point (VP) and allowing you to claim a matching resource whenever anyone completes a building of this color.

If you Plot instead of Command, you first copy one order showing in another player's area (if you have an activity of the same color), then you either draw until you have five cards or draw one card (if you already have at least five).

The game continues until one or more players hits a VP threshold (14-20 depending on the number of players). After completing the round (giving everyone the same number of turns), the player with the most VPs wins.
128063.name: Uchronia
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 77!
[Reviews] N°38-B Ali sous un Gingko à Andor en pleine Uchronie

128064.name: The Deadly Flower
128064.description:
From Introduction:

The characters encounter what seems to be a fantastic mystery but end up fighting an alien enemy. They discover that flowers may be intriguing, frightening and even deadly dangerous!

128065.name: Airship Intrigue
128065.description:
From Introduction:

The Characters are on the airship Pugilist, coming from a nation haunted by fear of imminent war. They soon discover that their trip is not free from intrigue, frights and danger.

128066.name: Jungle Behemoth
128066.description:
From Introduction:

The Characters are on the airship Pugilist, coming from a nation haunted by fear of imminent war. They soon discover that their trip is not free from intrigue, frights and danger.

128067.name: The Crawlers
128067.description:
From Introduction:

The characters are members of the International Atomic Science society, trying to contain the uncanny new dangers of the Atomic Age!

128068.name: The Crushed Mind
128068.description:
From Introduction:

The characters pay a visit to friend confined into an asylum, which leads to frightful findings and deadly dangers.

128069.name: No Bones About It
128069.description:
From Introduction:

This scenario can be used to introduce Strands of Fate to new players or be dropped into an ongoing campaign. It is designed to be played in an hour or two. Sample characters are included for players who wish to jump right into the adventure.

Setting
Nippon is a fantasy version of medieval Japan with the Samurai ruling class and all of the social structures. However, Nippon has these additions:

Magic exists
Mythical creatures exist
A nonSamurai character while still socially bound to follow the orders of the Samurai lords may defend himself from an attack by a Samurai. (Historically if a nonSamurai fought and/or killed a Samurai they were guilty of murder regardless of the circumstances.)





Situation
The son of the local Daimyo (feudal leader) has broken his leg in a bad horse riding accident. The break is severe and the local healers are unable to set it properly. The Daimio has ordered one of his Samurai to escort a Bonze (priest/healer), an ashiguru (Peasant Warrior), and a hunter/tracker to find a Kappa (mythical turtle man) that is rumored to live in a nearby stream. Some Kappa are known to have special knowledge in the treatment of broken bones and the Daimio hopes that this one can be convinced to teach the Bonze this ability. Kappa are also known for using a form of Sumo wrestling that can break bones.

128070.name: Strands of the Great Kaiju War
128070.description:
From Introduction:

A dark dream; Nuclear Detonations open portal to another realm, opening a way to the denizens to pour into ours. The Barrier was cracked first somewhat by the Nazi nuclear test in Ohrdruf, Thuringia on 4 March 1945, and the smallest of the future Openings. Then it was damaged by the Trinity test by the United States Army on July 16, 1945 on New Mexico, at the White Sands Proving Ground. This Opening is similar size as the latter ones, but less active for some reason. The Barrier itself was finally pierced by the atomic bomb dropped on Hiroshima on August 6, 1945, which also, by some odd symmetry detonated the still dismantled Fat Man Nuclear device at the same moment at Tinian, one of the three principal islands of the Commonwealth of the Northern Manianas Islands, the principal airbase for the United States B-29 Superfortress bombers. The cancerous growth that Kaiju produce makes the flora and fauna take strange turn here and maybe on other places too. Flora gains odd coloring, smells and growth patterns, fauna mutates to new, strange ways. The detonation area soon changes into what seems like Alien Landscape, becoming extremely hostile to all human life.

128072.name: Vege Tables
128072.description:
A new, fun, card game that combines easy rules to follow with an exciting game strategy, Vege Tables is a game suitable for everyone from 10 to 99 year old. Establish your land and plant your seed. Watch your seeds sprout turn into plants, than finally transform into tasty fruits and vegetables! Who will be the first in complete the job? Can you hamper or even block your opponent's work? Make good use of the "Tractor" and you will be the winner! The Vege Tables playing deck consists of 4 series of cards (coloured red, green, black, yellow) numbered from 1 to 20 and 8 Jokers card ("Tractors") giving a total of 88 cards.

Vege Tables is a true card game, like Spades or Hearts: at each turn a player can use all the cards he wants, but at least one must be used, in order to terminate all the cards dealt in the game preparation. The basic strategy is to hold the cards needed by the opponents, avoiding to open the sequences which can help other players… but opportunities to score points during the game can drive players to very different strategic approaches.

The game is for 4 players, but on the website you can find (and download for free) the rules for three a and five, the chess-like version for 2 players, the tournament variations and the play in partnership. Vege Tables is a mathematic game with very simple rules but to become a great player is not so easy...

128073.name: Skażenia
128073.description:
Publisher's blurp:

„Skażenia” to 20. dodatek do gry fabularnej Neuroshima. 48-stronicowa książka jest pigułką wiedzy na temat postapokaliptycznego środowiska i jego zagrożeń.

Translation:

"Skażenia" is 20th sourcebook for the role playing game Neuroshima. Inside "Skażenia" you will find 48 pages about post-apocalyptic enviorments.

128074.name: 30 Sided Character and Other Tales
128074.description:
From the front cover:

"All Armory 30 sided dice tables are suitable for use with all fantasy role-playing games."

User Summary:

The book is divided into three chapters. The first, "The 30 Sided Character" features tables for randomizing player character backgrounds, such as "Family and Kinsman Who Influenced You" and "Childhood Trauma Affecting You."

The second chapter, "The 30 Sided Non-Player Character," provided gamemasters with tables like "People You Meet In A Bazaar" and "Conversations With Tavern Owners."

The final chapter, "The 30 Sided Land," features tables relating to monsters, equipment, and magic, such as "Weapons, Weapons" and "Alternate Worlds."

128075.name: War Echoes
128075.description: War Echoes is a 32mm tabletop miniature game, set among a science fiction background. War Echoes uses squad level skirmish combat tactics on an individual character driven system. Five different factions and alien races populate the landscape each with its own unique weapons, abilities and game play style. War Echoes utilizes d10 dice for rolling, with character stamina ratings based on a modifier system for everything from movement to combat.

128076.name: 30 Sided Adventure and Other Tales
128076.description:
From the back cover:

"Encounters in the Strange Lands is a complete set of 20 excitingly new and different dice tables for the 30 Sided Dice. Teaming the dice designing brilliance of the Armory and the sly humor of Bob Liddil (author of The Armory's 30 Sided Character and Other Tales,) This book is both entertaining and enhancing to any Fantasy Adventure game which employs dice."

User Summary:

Most of the tables in this book describe encounters and locations in "The Strange Lands," a fantasy setting created by Liddil. Also included are a system-generic adventure ("The Search for Fezeneclop's Treasure") and a short story ("Stopover at the Crying Lion"), both set in the Strange Lands.

128077.name: The Landing
128077.description:
User Summary:

A sourcebook describing "The Landing," an Earth shopping mall that caters to alien teenagers.

This book was intended to be the first in a series of sourcebooks describing "Majestic City," a complete campaign setting for Teenagers From Outer Space, but none of the followup books were published.

128079.name: Dr. Keeton's Machine
128079.description:
From 1km1kt.net

Written for the 2012 24-hour RPG contest. It is a Victorian-Steampunk era RPG taking place inside a computer. It uses a relatively simple D20 combat system, and is best for one-shots.

There is almost no pre-game accounting, so you can dive in almost immediately

128081.name: Sudoku Puzzle Game
128081.description:
A 1- or 2(+)-Player sudoku game where players place number tiles to complete up to 100 different puzzles.

From the Rule Book:
For 2 or more players. Game One: Chose a puzzle from the book, place the red number squares on the puzzle board in the same positions as in the puzzle you have selected from the book. Now take turns -- one move each player -- to try to comlete the game as quickly as possible. Socring -- if you complete a line either across or down then that player adds up the numbers in that line and that is that players score for that game. The player with the highest score is the winner after you have completed all nine squares.

For 2 or more players. Game Two: Set up the numbers in the squares as before. Player one now turns over the timer and puts on black squares until the timer runs out. As before add up the numbers in any line that player completes to determine that players score. When the timer runs out pass on the timer to player 2 who then turns over the timer and when it runs out that player scores as above. Then pass the timer to the next player who plays the game in the same way and so on depending on the number of players. When the puzzle is finished then the player with the highest score wins that game.

128082.name: Tutatis
128082.description:
Tutatis is a fantasy gaelic football game produced by Greebo Miniatures, an italian editor already known for its high quality fantasy miniatures. The game is set in the fantasy world of Triskearth, a brand new world utterly created by the designers of the game. Its history and geography, as well as the background for every race, are described in the first 150 pages of the rulebook. The remaining twenty pages describe the gaming rules, bringing to life a fast & furios game of tactic and bashing!

The game is played on a 11 x 16 squares field, each team can field on the pitch seven payers. Every team (are planned to be released nearly thirty teams) has its own rooster of players, each one with its stats (movement, strength, agility, constitution, ball play), skills and costs, including three different captains. The game time is divided in two halves each one made up of six turns for each player. Turns are played alternatively by each player, completing the action of a single player before passing to the next one. The aim of the game is to score more points (goals or kicks over the crossbar) than the opponent, and you can achieve this with a passing/dodging style or with a more brutal one. Someone could recognize a gameplay similar to other games concerning sports, but this is not a great flaw since Tutatis has it's peculiar flavor thanks to the rules of gaelic football (ie. not forward passage, soloing rule exc.) and to the characterization of each team.

Greebo miniatures has produced a prerelease box of the game (with rules still in beta) at the 2011 Lucca Comics & Games convention, and it was a sold out. That box contained a cardboard field, Italian rulebook, two Greebo's d6, a ball and two teams in 15mm (orcs and dwarves). Since then on Greebo's website have been published in English and in Italian the definitive set of rules and the roosters for the new teams, all available as free downloads. At the moment have been released three kinds of fields (irond peak, thornwell and standard), the miniatures of some mercenaries and nine teams: orcs, dwarves, evil puppets, necros, poffy and five different teams of thornwell (frogs, lizards, turtles, snakes and a mixed team). Greebo's team is working on the championship rules expected to be released as open beta in mid autumn 2012, as well as on a new edition of the game box. It's also on the desk the translation of the rules in french and spanish.

128083.description:
Objective: gather most quiz cards finding correct answers
- acting by turn -
1. players come to an understanding which side to use (blue or red)
2. depending on no. of players each one is dealt 3-6 cards
3. active player asks first question - multiple choice (left neighbour); if wrong, next player's turn; if correct, second question is asked;
4. right? hand card over! wrong? next player may answer if he/she bets (an already won) card; wrong? give back risked card - questioned card is taken out, too.
5. game ends after all cards are played.
128083.name: Die wilden Fußballkerle  Verquizzt nochmal!

128084.name: Chase the Mouse
128084.description:
Object: To be the last player left in the game.
Contents: 36 cards

Before you begin, find 3 tokens (buttons, sweets etc.) for each player. These represent his 3 “lives" and when he has lost them he is out of the game. The pack consists of 4 sets of cards numbered from 1 to 9, which have the following order of importance from highest to lowest:
Farmer's Wife, Dog, Cat, Mouse. Therefore, the 3 of "Dog" beats the 3 of “Cat".

The dealer shuffles the pack and deals one card, face down, to each player. During the game you must try to avoid holding the lowest card. The first player to the dealer's left looks at his card.
He can either say "Stick" and keep it or exchange it for the card belonging to the next player on his left in the hope of getting a higher number and/or set. The next player does the same and so on until it is the dealer's turn. He can either “Stick" or exchange his card for the top one of the pack.
Then all players turn their cards face up and whoever holds the lowest one puts one token into the kitty.
If 2 players hold the same lowest number, the lower set loses. All players put their cards onto a discard pile. The next player becomes the dealer. When the pack has been played through once, pick up the discard pile, shuffle it and play on. Play continues until there is only one player left who wins all the tokens from the kitty.

128085.name: The New York Times Photo Trivia Game
128085.description:
Info from the game box:

Images that shape our times. The most fascinating people. Compelling news stories from the twentieth century.

NEW YORK Photo Trivia is an exciting, challenging trivia game that will test your knowledge of people, places and events that help shape our lives.

Travel around the United States covering the most compelling stories of the last 150 years.

Roll the dice, answer trivia questions and collect the photos that have captured the world's imagination!

Includes:
300 NYT 3 x 5 Photograph Trivia Cards.
Cast Iron Transportation Game Pieces.
Full Color Game Board and 6 sided die.

128086.name: Μιλάτε ελληνικά;
128086.description:
A Modern Greek word game.

Info from the publisher's website:

You are given the definition of a word, its first letter and what kind of word it is. Find which word it is and beat your opponents while at the same time you are expanding your vocabulary.

Info from the publisher's website in Greek:
Έχεις τον ορισμό μιας λέξης, το αρχικό της και τι μέρος του λόγου είναι. Βρες την, κέρδισε τους αντιπάλους σου, πλούτισε το λεξιλόγιό σου.

Components (info from back of the box):
- Cards with 1800 Greek words
- Cards with 1200 foreign words
- 1 dice
- 6 player pieces
- 1 board
- 1 sheet or rules

128087.name: Λόγια λίγα και σοφά
128087.description:
A game about Greek proverbs.

Info from the publisher's website:
Game is in Greek. A challenging game with 580 proverbs, sayings and mottos. By playing it the players enrich their vocabulary, learn the meaning and the proper use of proverbs while having fun. They understand when "A miss is as good as a mile" why "Adversity makes a strange bedfellow" and why "A friend to all is a friend to none".

Info from the publisher's website in Greek:
Ανταγωνιστικό παιχνίδι με 580 παροιμίες, εκφράσεις, ρητά και λαϊκά γνωμικά. Παίζοντας, οι παίκτες εμπλουτίζουν το λεξιλόγιό τους, διδάσκονται την έννοια και τη χρηστικότητα των παροιμιών, ενώ παράλληλα ψυχαγωγούνται. Κατανοούν πότε έζωσαν κάποιον τα φίδια, σε ποια περίπτωση πέταξε το πουλάκι, τι σημαίνει του έδωσε τα παπούτσια στο χέρι, σε ποιον ταιριάζει ο νοών νοείτω, για ποιον λέμε ο πνιγμένος απ’ τα μαλλιά του πιάνεται...

128088.name: Ποιός Πού Πότε Γιατί?  για παιδιά
128088.description:
A children's version of Ποιός Πού Πότε Γιατί?.

A Greek trivia game for primary school children, 2400 questions about Geography, History, Arts, Animals and Plants, Sports and Science. The players move around a board and try to reach the finish line first.

(An earlier edition seems to have 1500 questions, a newer one 2400.)

Greek description:
Η παιδική έκδοση του Ποιός Πού Πότε Γιατί?.

Ένα ελληνικό παιχνίδι για τους μικρούς μας φίλους, με 2400 ερωτήσεις Γεωγραφίας, Ιστορίας, Τέχνης, Ζώων και Φυτών, Αθλητισμού και Επιστήμης. Οι παίκτες κινούνται στο ταμπλό και προσπαθούν να φτάσουν πρώτοι τον τερματισμό.

128089.name: Oink's Card Game
128089.description:
Contents: 36 cards in 6 sets of six.
Object of the Game: To collect six identical cards.

Sort out one set of 6 identical characters per player. Place other cards out of the game. Shuffle and deal six cards face down to each player. The game consists of exchanging cards as quickly as possible. Each player looks at his cards, decides which one he wishes to exchange and places it face down in front of the player to his left. Each player then picks up the card placed in front of him and adds it to his hand before deciding which card to exchange next. To keep play running smoothly, the players should simultaneously say “Pass” and "Pick Up". The first player to get six identical cards and shout "OINK" is declared the winner.

128091.name: The Blasphemous Brewery of Pilz!
128091.description:
From the front cover:

Something has happened to the delicious beer in Shattenberg! None of the residents have seen the brewing monks for weeks and the tavern masters are oddly silent. Where once it was a delicious and creamy blend of mountain mushroom-based stout, it now offers an odd coppery taste and costs twice as much. For a small mining and farming town on the edge of the wilderness, this is a tragedy. Now rumors have begun circulating that hideous creatures gathered to the north are somehow the cause. The players are hired to investigate and, if possible, remedy the problem.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
128092.name: The Magic Balance
128092.description:
From the front cover:

An eccentric wizard experimenting with planar travel has upset a critical balance in the Realms of Arkonus. With magic in Arkonus gone awry, can the PCs find the cause and restore the balance?

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
128093.name: The Secrets of the Summoning Chamber
128093.description:
From the front cover:

An ancient wizard’s lair now holds more than just the remnants of his failed experiments. It is up to the brave adventurers to end threat to the nearby town and plunder the Wizard’s summoning room.

128094.name: Pixel Blocked!
128094.description:
User Summary

Pixel Blocked! is a puzzle game, where the player is tasked to complete a shape by rotating the target object and shooting blocks toward it that add to the shape.

In addition to successfully completing the shape, the player is also awarded medals based on the efficiency of the number of moves taken as well as the overall time taken to complete the puzzle.

128095.name: Wicked Crush
128095.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Enter the world of Wicked Crush, where a centuries-spanning war between humans and beastmen dictates life. But in the isolated beastmen town of Rosachelia, where you (as either a dude or a chick) fall from the sky, it's the almighty dollar that reigns.

The town's entire economy revolves around profiting from the lives of adventurers foolish enough to enter Dynidar, the seemingly endless, constantly changing dungeon that borders the town. The townspeople provide the sales of items, services in forging equipment and even renovate the dungeon to make it deadlier. Despite this seemingly grim lifestyle, the townsfolk are actually quite friendly. Sharing a common interest in getting that paper, you are quickly welcomed among the Rosachelian people. It is then that you decide to be the first to reach the bottom depths of Dynidar and discover the endless riches and dark secrets that await.


Wicked Crush is a PC game designed around the concept of an online game where you play alone, but everything you do has a direct effect on other players.

Taking inspiration from classic action games like Castlevania and Mega Man, along with modern games like Demon's Souls, Little Big Planet, Persona 4 and Ys, the game promises to meld the responsive controls and compact movesets of old with unique online functionality, player-generated content, and beautiful, high definition, frame-by-frame 2D animation.

The player's ultimate goal is to reach the deepest levels of Dynidar, each floor is actually made by another player pulled from an online server. If you complete the floor without dying, you will find gold or valuables at the end, and the creator of the floor will receive a small amount of gold. However, if you die, the floor's creator earns a much larger sum. What this ultimately means is that players are rewarded for making crafty levels that rake in the deaths.

This use of player-generated content creates the unique challenge to giving the game a fair learning curve, slowly increasing difficulty while adding mechanics, and ensuring that the aesthetics remain cohesive. This is being achieved by grouping floors together into “tiers”, each of which has a specific amount and types of enemies and traps that may be employed, combined with a constantly updating ratio of successful and failed runs to determine how easy or difficult a floor is, where in Dynidar it should be placed, and how big the payout for completing it should be.

Between dungeon runs, the player will return to the town of Rosachelia. In town, players can rest, talk to the townsfolk, purchase items (such as potions, temporary strength supplements, and signs to leave behind for other players), upgrade their equipment, and build floors for Dynidar.

Source: The Game Website.

128096.name: Knightfall 2
128096.description:
User Summary

Knightfall 2 is the sequel to Knightfall, a puzzle-RPG in which Knight, the main, knightly character ventures across a world of peril at the command of his wife, who has become disgruntled with Knight's early retirement.
