Featuring the same drill-toting Knight, Knightfall 2 involves similar game-play to its prequel: removing like coloured blocks and rotating the board so as to place Knight above his foes or to procure either treasure or the key for the level exit. Knightfall 2 is longer, includes magic spells and items, new monsters, new level designs, and boss fights.

128097.name: NOD (Issue 2 - Jun 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Fantastik Fiction: Phantastes by George MacDonald
128097.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the wicked city of Ophir - more than 60 encounters! This issue of NOD also contains a narrative naval combat system, new classes (thief, assassin, venturer, elan), fourteen magic candles, alternate treasures, books & scrolls and ideas on running urban and wilderness adventures. Plus - a serialization of George MacDonald's classic fantasy novel Phantastes.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Origins Awards Best Historical Board Game Nominee
128098.description:
Game description from the publisher:

It is near dawn on April 6th, 1862. The first major clash of arms in the western theater of the American Civil War is about to commence!

In Clash of Wills: Shiloh 1862, you and your opponent each control one of the opposing armies. As the Confederate player, you open the battle with a devastating surprise attack on the Union camps around Shiloh church. If you can rout the disorganized blue coats and take Pittsburg Landing before reinforcements arrives, you can deal a potentially fatal blow to the invading Yankees. As the Union player you must survive the initial onslaught and hold back the advancing rebels on the first day of battle. Then, the next day, you can deploy your full forces to crush this latest threat to the survival of the United States. Whose will prevails?
128098.name: Clash of Wills: Shiloh 1862

128099.name: NOD (Issue 3 - Jul 2010)
128099.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of NOD contains a massive sandbox set in the vast wasteland of a ruined empire. It also contains new classes (13 different bestial humanoids, the elementalist and the druid), a fantasy Egyptian pantheon and another chapter of George MacDonald's classic story Phantastes.

128100.name: Urlaubsländerquiz Deutschland
128100.description:
Trivia game about Germany.
The game consists of 240 questions in the categories Town and Country, Art and Culture, History and Modern Times, Food and Drinks, Sports, Leisure and Holiday as well as Demands, 5 questions and 1 demand per cards, in varying sequences. Correct answers earn souvenirs, demands must be fulfilled when possible and change ownership of souvenirs. One can only hold a limited number of souvenirs of a kind, or must exchange them. Whoever has the most souvenirs at the end of the game wins.

128101.name: Kell a gól!
128101.description:
A Hungarian football-themed trivia game. Players answer questions and move their player pieces on a board.

Components: 1 game board, 8 player pieces, 800 cards with 4800 questions, 1 die, game rules

128102.name: Anarktica: Fate of Heroes
128102.description:
From publisher blurb:
It is the year 1899 and the world is in the grip of the Great Game as Victoria, the Everqueen of the British Empire, duels with the North Tsar of Russia for global supremacy.

Despite Tsarist advances in Central Asia, the British conquests of Afghanistan and Sudan have given them the upper hand. But now the Scryers of the Court of St. James foretell the emergence of the greatest threat to the Empire since the demon Napoleon a century before.

A new power is rising from beyond the realms of the human nations, from the uncharted lands at the base of the world. The frozen continent of Anarktica.

Anarktica: Fate of Heroes is a steampunk story game. It is completely free to download, to reproduce and distribute. It tells the story of a group of four heroes, their journey across the land of Anarktica, and their encounters with its inhabitants, creatures, monsters and mysteries. Outwardly brave and resolute, each hero is saddled with a terrible secret that tears at their soul and taints their trust in their companions until finally they encounter the Adversary and their true nature is revealed.

It's a low prep, quick playing scenario based on the Archipelago 2nd edition rule-set by Matthijs Holter and inspired by its gaming offspring Love in the Time of Seið by Matthijs Holter and Jason Morningstar. It requires five players and should take three to five hours.

128103.description:
BUILD a party of specialized fantasy heroes.

CONSTRUCT a battlefield with environment tiles, terrain, and fortifications.

DESTROY your opponent(s) with a mix of melee, ranged, and magical attacks.

TactDecks: Reign of Heroes is a fully customizable, expandable battle system. A single set supports 2 players, or add additional sets to increase the size of your battlefield and options.

Highly portable and adaptable, TactDecks supports a creative combination of battlefield layout and party configurations. Whatever your tactical preference - spell, sword, arrow, subterfuge, or a little bit of everything - TactDecks adapts to your tactical style.

There's no arenas. No static mats. Movement is organic and possible in every conceivable direction (including up and down). Climb, move, or demolish terrain, don't just look at it!
128103.name: TactDecks: Reign of Heroes

128104.name: Mass Effect Infiltrator
128104.description:
User Summary

Mass Effect Infiltrator is a cover-based third-person shooter. The game was developed as an iOS tie-in with Mass Effect 3. Though it shares the setting and visual style of the console trilogy, Infiltrator focuses on action, with little narrative, character development, RPG elements, or moral choices to speak of.

128105.description:
Objective: be the first scoring as many goals as agreed (3 or more)
- acting simultaniously/ 2 players or 2 teams (red and blue) -
game board has to be prepared (each row - 6 in total - is filled up with 5 slides/different numbers)
ball must be moved (from the attacker) into the next closer row in direction of defender's keeper: attacker nominates 2 (of 11) meeples with hidden numbers ==> multiply both to move ball upon a matching slide/area; defender acts in a similar way; if successful (same result) defender becomes attacker; if not, attacker gets closer to the goal ==> additional turn (with less meeples on both sides).
Close enough to score? - use goal & keeper chips in a similar way.
128105.name: Die wilden Fußballkerle  Schuss ... Tor!

128106.name: NOD (Issue 4 - Sep 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Fantastik Fiction: Phantastes by George MacDonald
128106.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue of NOD: A sandbox hexcrawl with more than 200 encounters, 50 new monsters inspired by European folklore, a pantheon of deities inspired by the Dacians and Thracians and two dungeon adventures - one for low-level parties and the other for mid-level parties. Plus - the next installment of our serialization of George MacDonald's fantasy classic, Phantastes.

128107.name: NOD (Issue 5 - Oct 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Fantastik Fiction: Phantastes by George MacDonald
Featured Article: Ibis - City of Sorcerers
128107.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue of NOD: Vampires from around the world, Ibis - City of Sorcerers, The Illusionist, Medieval Mining, Level 2 of Izrigul's Pleasure Palace, Mystery Men! - converting your fantasy RPG into a comic book RPG and the continuation of George MacDonald's classic story Phantastes.

128108.name: Asteria
128108.description:
From the back of the book:

ASTERIA

Rollespillet der passer til alle fantasy systemer

Kunne du tænke dig, sammen med dine venner, at opleve et fabelagtigt univers med monstre og magi?

Vil du se om dine venner kan holde sammen når det virkelig gælder? Om de vil arbejde sammen og hjælpe de som er i nød, eller om de vil blive skurke? Med denne bog får du mulighed for det!

ASTERIA er et bordrollespil for 2-7 deltagere, som giver dig en hel ø med byer, labyrinter, magi, monstre og masser af eventyr, du kan sende dine venner ud på!

Er du ny rollespiller, er ASTERIA en god begyndelse, da du her får en grundig forklaring i, hvordan du og dine venner nemt kommer i gang med bordrollespil.

Er du erfaren spiller, kan du endda benytte dit eget ynglings-regelset med ASTERIA - selv dine liverollespilsregler kan benyttes hertil.

Har dine spillere hvad der skal til, for at redde den problemfyldte ø ASTERIA?

Translates to:

ASTERIA

The roleplaying game that can be used with all fantasy systems

Would you like, together with your friends, to experience a faboules universe with monsters and magic?

Would you like to see if your friends can stick together when it really counts? If they can work together and help those in need, or will they become villains? With this book you will be able to!

ASTERIA is a table-top-roleplayinggame for 2-7 players, which gives you an entire island with cities, labyrinths, magic, monsters and lots of adventures for you to send your friends off to!

If you are a new roleplayer. ASTERIA will be a good beginning, as you get a good explanation of how you and your friends gets started on table-top-roleplaying.

If you are an experienced roleplayer, you will be able to use your own favorite roleplaying rules with ASTERIA - even your liveroleplaying rules can be used.

Have your players got what it takes to safe the island Asteria with all it's problems?

128109.name: Disneyland Snip Game
128109.description:
Any number can play. All the 36 cards are dealt face down to the players. Each player keeps his cards, without looking at them, face down in front of him. The player on the left of the dealer starts the game by turning up his top card and placing it face up in the centre of the table.
When a “PUT" card (marked with numbers 1,2 or 3) is turned up the next player has to put down the number of cards shown. If in doing so he turns up a “PUT" card, the next player has to put down the required number.
Should no “PUT” card turn up in the cards laid down, the player who laid the “PUT” card takes all from the centre of the table.
The player who gets all the cards wins the game.

128110.name: Insta-Character
128110.description:
From the book's introduction:

"This system can be readily used by Game Master and players alike. How many times have you gotten to a game late, only find that your character's statistics sheet was left at home? Normally you would waste a good half-hour of game time creating a new one. Well, not any longer. Now you can roll up a character and equip him or her in less than five minutes! Game Masters can easily use the system to outfit and create encounters or non-player characters."

User Summary:

The entire booklet is a set of tables for creating AD&D-compatible character with three rolls.

The "Character Statistics" table (which in in the back of the book, despite being the one gamers are instructed to use first) uses a d1000 to generate all six character scores at once. This table takes up half the pages in book, and continues onto the inside back cover.

After choosing the character's class, a second roll on (using a d10 or d20 a class-specific subtable) selects the character's weapons and armor. Finally a d6-based "Backpack Sets" table determines what non-class-specific gear the character is carrying.

(The book itself never mentions AD&D by name, but all character have six ability scores in the 3-18 range, and the weapon/armor combinations respect AD&D character class restrictions.)

128111.name: Some'R'Set
128111.description:
Some 'R' Set is a trick-taking game that uses a unique deck of 28 cards. The card suits are fractions (ex. 0/0, 0/1, 1/1, 0/2, 1/2, 2/2, ..., 0/3,..., 0/4, ..., 0/,6, ... 6/6) with the mid-cards also being worth extra points.

Some'R'Set is best played with partners (like in Spades).

The object is to bid on how many points you and your partner will take. There are 21 available points, 14 from the available tricks and 7 from the red cards.

Bidding goes around the table once where the players bid for the two card blind. High bid takes the blind and decides which suit (fraction set) will be trump.

Like in many trick taking games, and if you make your hand, you get the points. If you do not, you are set, hence the name (as they say in the rules) Some "r" set.

See also:
Double Some'R'Set - 50 card version

128112.name: Mäuse Trio
128112.description:
Can you avoid three cats and dispose of all your cards.

The cards are actually called Guckloch-Karten and are triangle shaped (to represent a slice of cheese). Further more each card has six 'faces'. Each 'face' will either be a cat, or a mouse, or a hole. The holes mean that when it is placed on a stack, the 'faces' on the card underneath the holes will show through.

The game is played in rounds and a round ends when one player has no cards left.

Each player gets a stack of cards. The board is plastic and represents a cheese. In a turn a player takes the top card of his stack and chooses which side to play. Then he lays the card in the sliced area of the board. Then the next player does the same, and so on.

The object is to lay a card so that at least 3 mouse faces are visible. If this is acheived, the player can play another card. And so on, but no more than 3 cards can be played in a single turn. Should a player play a card that has three cat faces shown, that player must take up all the cards played so far and put them at the bottom of his stack. If you use your last card, you win the round and receive a cheese token.

The first player to get three cheese tokens, wins.

128113.name: NOD (Issue 7 - Feb 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Fantastick Fiction: Phantastes by George MacDonald
128113.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first issue of 2011 features three fantasy cities from the Land of Nod, two demon lords with which to threaten your players, a new race for PARS FORTUNA, a mini-dungeon adventure and a write up on Saint Valentinus and his bardic knights.

128114.description:
You are a Navy SEAL. You are trained to confront terrorists and insurgents. You deal with hidden explosives, snipers and other unknown dangers. In the darkness of the ocean's depths or the vastness of the merciless desert, you expect the unexpected. You're on a mission. You work as a dedicated team, relying on the skills of expert marksmen and suburb tacticians. Careful planning and precise timing improve odds of success, but unforeseen events could jeopardize the mission.

Hooyah: Navy Seals Card Game is a cooperative game in which 1 to 4 players assume the roles of Navy SEALS trying to complete a real-life-inspired Special Ops mission. You either win or lose as a group. To meet the rigorous requirements of the mission, you must collect all of the Skills and Equipment cards required for each Op. All phases of the mission must be completed without the loss of life and before time runs out.
128114.name: Hooyah: Navy Seals Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 23 - Putting Rocks in our Pudding!
Ook ook ook! oook oooook! Hooya!

128115.name: NOD (Issue 8 - Apr 2011)
rpgissuearticle: The Land of the Dragon Clans
128115.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enter the land of the Dragon Chans! This issue presents a sandbox hex crawl inspired by the folklore and literature of Asia, as well as a new class, the wushen, options for warriors, many new monsters and a pantheon based on Lord Dunsany's Gods of Pegana.

128116.name: Pony's Handbook
128116.description:
user summary

The Pony's Handbook is the guide for players in the Ponies & Parasprites roleplaying game. It covers character creation, basic mechanics, and basic rituals, and includes an introduction to the world and cities of Equestria. The conclusion of the book is the transcript of an example play session for players who have never played a roleplaying game before.

128117.name: PiC's Guide
128117.description:
user summary

The PiC's Guide is the guide for gamemasters (here called the "Pony In Charge") in the Ponies & Parasprites roleplaying game. It covers task resolution, special items, hazards and pitfalls, and the powers granted by the signature Elements of Harmony, as well as a sample adventure, "Everlasting Night."

128118.name: Ponies & Parasprites  Bestiary
128118.description:
user summary

This bestiary gives Ponies & Parasprites rules for the various animals and monsters, in the land of Equestria, whether mundane (cat, rabbit), natural (cockatrice, manticore), unique (diamond dog, parasprite), or supernatural (changeling, wendigo). Additionally, the Bestiary includes more detailed combat rules. Finally, the bestiary includes notes on new optional character races: baby dragon, buffalo, donkey, griffon, mule, and zebra.

128119.name: Ponies & Parasprites Expanded Content
128119.description:
user summary

The Expanded Content manual describes non-official, fan-made works for the Ponies & Parasprites roleplaying game. In addition to exploring the farther reaches of Equestria (such as Stalliongrad and Camelroon), the Expanded Content manual includes three new races; new Elements besides the signature six Elements of Harmony; and a set of villainous counterparts to the Elements of Harmony, the Manifestations of Pandemonium. The book ends with sheets of pregenerated characters.

128120.name: Dust Warfare: Campaign Book Hades
128120.description:
Game description from the publisher:

It is 1947, and the armies of the three great blocs have collided in a small city along the Caspian Sea. Zverograd, a city that lies at the divide of continents, lies also at a crossroads in world history. Now, the battle that has raged here for months has reached its tipping point, and only through the use of recently developed technological terrors and innovative new tactics can any of the three warring factions prevail.
Dust Warfare: Campaign Book Hades, a supplement for Dust Warfare, continues the tense struggle for this all-important metropolis, while adding new rules, options, and stats for upcoming Dust Warfare units. This 48-page softcover book has details on locations around Zverograd, rules for Tesla weapons, and new special abilities. What's more, this jam-packed resource features the epic Hades Campaign, a long-term conflict in which players plan their engagements using a detailed overland map of Zverograd.

128122.name: Ysgarth Minirules
128122.description:
From the "Version IV" introduction:

"These aren't the complete rules to Ysgarth. The minirules are the most basic version of the rules, with enough information to play a limited game of Ysgarth, but without some of the details and refinements. Complete mechanics can be found in the full version of the 6th edition rules."

User Summary:

A variety of these "minirules" documents were produced, typically distributed at game conventions or via the mails. They ranged from a single double-sided page to an eight-page folio pamphlet. The longer versions typically contained advertising materials as well as rules.

The game's designer, David Nalle, was also posting various iterations of the minirules online (as a plain text without art) as early as 1995.

The minirules appear to have been revised fairly often. Version 2.5 is dated 1993, Version 4 is dated 1994, Version 5.2 is dated 1995, and Version 6.7 is dated 1998. Nearly all of these documents appeared after the publication of the 6th Edition rules (in 1992).

Note the Version 6.1 and 6.7 documents contain minor rules errata, demonstrating the iterative development of a planned (but never published) 7th edition game.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Kinder Recommended
128123.description:
The game consists of 30 treasure chest tiles which also show a jewel in one of six colors, and six large wooden pirate meeples.
The tiles are laid out in a 6 x 5 grid and a pirate is placed on a tile of each color, covering the jewel so it can no longer be seen. The active player now rolls a color die and has to find the jewel in the right color (by picking up the pirate). If correct, the player gets the tile and places the pirate on another tile in that color. If wrong, the pirate is put back onto the tile. The game ends when only three colors are left; the player with most tiles is the winner.
128123.name: Captain Kidd

128124.name: The Realm of Agennul
boardgamepodcastepisode: House Rules 38: Interview with the Designers of Realm of Agennul
128124.description:
The Realm of Agennul is an ever evolving board game where you control the fate of the characters and the future of the realms. Our goal is to create a fantasy world and outlet for participants to collaborate and decide how characters, realms, and the lore develop within the game.

Players receive two characters, which must work together to earn the patronage of cities within Agennul. During the game players must protect those cities from invading players who are also competing for the control of the Realm.

Use characters to navigate through the Realm and conquer cities to gain coin and control of Agennul. With the coin upgrade, increase your city's defenses by paying coin for a fortification or purchase equipment for your characters to increase their abilities. Engage in epic battles between players as ego's grow while the limited towns and cities are fought over. Be conniving and pay off players to avoid conflict in order to secure your advancement in the Realm.

The Realm of Agennul is very simplistic at its core but can develop into a complicated strategic game as power shifts around the table between players.

The first player to have control of the most cities as well as the patronage of the Hero's City of Anos, is anointed as The Hero of Agennul and Protector of the Realms.

128126.name: Ragnarok Odyssey
videogamehonor: 2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PlayStation Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
128126.description:
User Summary

Ragnarok Odyssey is set in a world based on Norse mythology. A battle is being waged between humans and giants after the fall of the gods had previously separated the races.

There are over 20,000 combinations based on gender, facial features, and accessories with six selectable job classes wich include Sword Warrior, Hunter, Hammersmith, Assassin, Mage and Cleric.

128127.name: Planet of the Apes
128127.description:
From the back of the box:

Fight for humanity as Ulysses, a deep-space astronaut shipwrecked on Earth nearly 2,000 years into the future. To his horror, a deadly breed of intelligent apes have evolved from mankind and now dominate the Earth. Hunted to near-extinction, the ragtag human survivors huddle in fear of the Empire.

Against impossible odds , Ulysses must infiltrate the simian society and halt the genocidal plan of Ape General Ursus to exterminate mankind forever. Familiar faces like Cornelius and Dr.Zaius - even new terrors like mandrill assassins and renegade baboons - await in this pulse -pounding tribute to the sci-fi cinema classic. The future of the human race lies with one. It lies with you.

128128.name: Pillow-Dex Tennis
128128.description: Following the success of Pillow-Dex, Parker released a more sophisticated (and more expensive) version. With the balloons, this version also has a cord net which you could tie between two chairs, and rackets. Based on the indoor parlor scene on the box, Parker intended for this to be a game for indoors.

128129.name: Maximum Football
128129.description:
Maximum-Football is the ultimate football game for the PC.

While the rest of the industry is abandoning the PC market for the console world of arcade football, Wintervalley is providing a PC football game like no other.

Unmatched in flexibility, Maximum-Football is truly the first 3D coaching football game of the millennium.

Maximum-Football. Step Up.

Source: The Publisher Website.

128132.name: Knockout Andy
128132.description: The game has 2 tops with spinners, and 10 small wooden pins that look sort of like bowling pins. The box bottom has four wooden pegs affixed in the pattern of a square in the center of the box. The eight pins are setup, and then each player in turn spins his top. % points for knocking a pin down, 10 points for throwing it out of the box. 500 points wins the game.

128133.name: Daze of Our Loans
128133.description:
Daze of Our Loans is a game for anyone with a sense of humor. The players are "lenders" that move around the board making loans and, sometimes, recovering on them. With luck they may even obtain collateral. When circumstances warrant, loans can be sold or participated out to others. Meanwhile, the economy may quickly change from normal times to recession or boom, sharply changing your loan portfolio values and affecting your strategy. Players must also deal with unpredictable court judgments, costly regulatory inquiries, bankruptcies, and documentation errors, among other common celebrations in a lender's day.

The game lasts for one hour, then all players get 2 more turns. The player with the most money wins.

128135.name: Thru the Clouds
128135.description: Simple race game where each of fours players race to get their three pegs from start to home. Spinner will give values between 1 and 4 for each spin.

128136.name: Scram
128136.description:
This is a simple children's game. At the start of each game each player takes his color marker's and covers up all the positions on his fourth of the board. When a player spins a number then he has to lift a marker that has that number under the marker. If another number is exposed, then the marker is returned. The first player to remove all his markers wins.

Since there is a combination of memory and luck, this would be an interesting game for an adult to play with a child.

128137.description:
Damage Report is a modular, 2-6 player, simultaneous, real-time, co-operative game where the players take on the role of a starship crew faced with making split-second decisions to survive while in the midst of various catastrophes. Unlike many co-operative games, the simultaneous, real-time nature of the game helps prevent groupthink. This forces players to make decisions with minimal feedback and prevents one player from simply running the show. Your turn never ends, and is only limited to what you can accomplish in 15, 30, 45 or 60 second intervals.

Each player uses a timer to keep track of their time, moving the timer down a track based upon how long their turn interval is. In most scenarios, the turn interval is based upon the Life Support system status: the more damaged the system is, the less air the player has to "breathe", thus each turn is extended, as it takes more time to complete their actions.

The modular board pieces in Damage Report ensure a brand new experience with each game scenario. Each scenario has their own 'success' and 'failure' conditions. The Standard Edition of the game includes three scenarios, however a number of additional scenarios will available as expansions. This will include a 7-10 player expansion.
128137.name: Damage Report

128138.name: Tiger Tom
128138.description:
The game has markers for each player and a spinner with the values 1-6. From the game board:

Directions for the game on "Tiger Tom" No 4660

Tiger tom is lost. Who will find him? Each player chooses the side he wishes to play on, and the one who spins the highest number starts the game. The spaces between the cross marks count one. The player has to follow the black line until he reaches the center where he will find Tiger Tom. The one who arrives there first finds Tiger Tom and wins the game. If a player lands on No. 1 by exact spin, he must go back and start again. If a player lands on any of the black spots by exact spin, he must go back five spaces. If he lands on a red spot, by exact spin, he may advance three spaces. A player may pass another but if he lands on the same space, he must go back to where he started and lose one turn. If four wish to play, two start from each side.

128139.name: Traps
128139.description:
Traps is a marble shooting game where each player tries to shoot marbles into specific locations on a board. When opened the game box creates a ramp, and a "backstop." One the backstop are seven position which have a hinged flap that shuts when a marble is shot through the opening. from left to right the positions are numbered 1 to 7. The positions also have point values of 5, 15, 10, 25, 10, 15, and 5. Three games can be played on the board, Traps, Golf and Tournament Play. From the directions:

HOW TO PLAY TRAPS

Any number of players may compete. Each player in turn will roll or shoot an inning of four balls, scoring the points as they are made, the one first reaching a total of five hundred points becoming the winner of the game.

HOW TO PLAY GOLF

TRAPS now becomes a seven hole links. Drive for No. 1 hole: after holeing, recover ball, return trap to closed position and shoot for No. 2; continue for the entire course. Player making seven holes in fewest shots is declared the winner.

Tournmment - Twenty-Five Bird Event

Player will specify by small number (not one or seven) the Pigeon he expects to break; if succesful, 1 is scored and player shoots again, first designating the intended shot (not one or seven); if again succesful, another point is credited and the third shot may be either 1 or seven, but in no case may one or seven be called, unless the shooter has previously broken two consecutive birds other than one or seven. failure to break the bird designated, loses the players turn, which goes to each entrant in rotation; winner is the one who first breaks 25 birds.

128140.name: Alchemist Wizard
128140.description:
As a wizard-alchemist you explore a large and magical world. Catch various creatures, and toss them into cauldrons to create powerful spells for combating your enemies.

9 types of monsters: Zombies, Skeletons, Ghosts, and etc
13 types of spells: Fireball, Freeze, Teleport, Firerain, Lightning, etc.
3 Big Bosses and the Main Demon Boss at the end of each world

Source: The Developer Website.

128141.name: Jack and the Bean Stalk
128141.description:
This is a simple chase and capture game in that the Giant is trying to catch Jack. The Giant is a large pawn shaped piece, and Jack is a small disc. There is a spinner with values of 1 to 5. There are interconnected paths with dots to mark positions along the paths. The game board is glued to the bottom of the two piece box.

Directions (from game board)

Jack the small piece starts from home, the Giant from Castle. Spin in turn, each player moving as many dots as spun over any route, either forward or backward. They cannot pass ecah other on the same path. If Giant lands on dot occupied by Jack, he wins. If Jack reaches Door of Giants Castle and gets home safely, he wins (having got the hen that lays the golden egg).

128142.description:
Winter has come. There's a brief cease-fire. The factions begun preparations for the next stage of war, a brutal clash that will come in a few months. In the meantime, though, they are reinforcing their troops. Thanks to the new resources found near the gigantic Frozen City, new leaders are preparing for spring. Winter sleep is, in the end, just a cover for a secret arms race...

Winter, an expansion pack for both 51st State and The New Era, introduces new rules and 54 new cards to both games that will reward gamers who prefer sustainable development over unpredictable aggression.

Winter lasts six weeks – i.e., six rounds – and during that time players prepare for the war that will take place after winter. Each round players can send their workers to Frozen City, a special mini board, to hire mercenaries and find new leaders. With Winter, the aim of the game has changed; you no longer fight for 30 victory points (VPs), developing in a rush to hit that total and win before the other player. Now you have a precise amount of time in which to plan and build, in which to develop your faction.

Winter introduces a new Texas faction that's crowded with people (four workers in the production phase) and has the possibility of using one of its faction contacts twice in a round.
128142.name: Winter

128143.name: Bean Bag Game
boardgameversion: J H singer first edition circa 1895
128143.description:
Came with four (4) wooden "bean bag" discs, a target board (with holes marked 5 points, 10 points and 20 points) and a stick with which to prop up the target board.

Directions from top of box:

Arrange the Game as shown in the Picture below. The players
pitch in turns, the first one who scores 50 points wins the
game.

Manufactured by J. H. Singer
New York, U. S. A.

128144.name: Home History Game
128144.description:
This is sort of a "Go Fish" type of card game, but three cards, out of the 105 cards in the game, are needed to make a book. Sets are determined by the day of the week upon which the historical event took place. From the rules:

4273
Home History Game
For Boys and Girls
Copyright 1909 By Milton Bradley

This game consists of 105 cards, each bearing a historical event and date, including the day and week upon which such event took place. The dealer in the first game is chosen by lot, and thereafter the deal goes in turn to the left. Shuffle the cards and deal one at a time beginning at the left until ten have been dealt to each player. The remainder are placed in a pile face down on the table. The player at the left of the dealer commences the game by making as many "books" as he can from his hand. Three cards of the same day constitute a book. These books are laid aside to be counted at the end of the game. The player now calls upon any player he wishes for any card (any day of the week) he, the caller, may need to complete a book. If successful, he may continue to call for and receive the needed cards from any of the players, until he calls for a card from a person who has not that card; he then draws three cards from the pile and the next player plays.

The players follow in turn at the left from the first player. At the end the player having secured the greatest number of books wins.

128145.name: Jet Race Game
128145.description:
A simple race game with 17 spaces on the board. The spinner has 8 different positions. So this is a very simple spin and move game. There are 4 markers that come with the game.

Spinner positions:

3 - Land
3 - Take off or Fly
1 - Fly
1 - Bad weather go back to last city (ie lose a space)

128146.name: Checkers 3
128146.description:
Checkers played with 2 or 3 players on a six-sided hex board, with 61 black hexagons touching only at their points, not their sides, leaving small red spaces between, and forming a larger overall hexagon. Each player picks a side separate from other players. Complexity comes not as much from the board itself but from the addition of an extra player's pieces.

Other 3 player Checkers variants have instead stretched a Checkers board's squares into a "Y" or triangular shape.

The publisher's name suggests there may have been a Chess variant published with a similarly styled board.

128147.name: B.A.T. II: The Koshan Conspiracy
128147.description:
B.A.T. 2 - The Koshan Conspiracy is a futuristic point and click adventure game written by Computer's Dream and published by Ubi Soft in 1992. It is the sequel to the 1990 game B.A.T.

It is a futuristic role-playing game in which the player explores the city, talks to non-player characters, tries to solve puzzles, travels to new cities by use of a mini-game, buys weapons and ammo, engages in fire fights (also by way of a mini-game), buys a spaceship, and enters space. The player can even re-wire a wrist computer (B.O.B) in the game to perform different functions. It has a very open, non-linear play style.

The Amiga and Atari ST versions shipped with a physical dongle to prevent piracy.

Source: Wikipedia, "B.A.T. II – The Koshan Conspiracy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

128148.name: Dragespillet
128148.description:
A simple and short game for young children.
"Get as high as you can and get the gold. But watch out - if you climb high it's a long fall."
Players climb up the dragon by rolling dies, and try to get gold pieces from the dragon. But if they get to high they fall down and have to start over again. When all the gold have been delt, the player with the most pieces wins.

128149.name: Tube Slider
128149.description:
Tube Slider is a futuristic racing game released exclusively in North America by NEC and developed by Nd Cube for the Nintendo GameCube on April 17, 2003. A Japanese release of this game was planned but was canceled for unknown reasons.

The main objective is to pilot a hovercraft through a track and compete against other racers (human or AI controlled). Tube Slider is unique in the fact, like its name, the vehicles race through transparent tubes that are often suspended off the ground. The modes available are a generic single-player mode, a time trial mode, and a multiplayer function.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tube Slider", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgamecompilation: Among the Stars: Expanding the Alliance
Among the Stars: Pre-order Promo Cards
128152.description:
Among the Stars: Ambassadorial Shuttle is a promotional Special Location card set available at the Artipia Games booth at Spiel 2012.

The card set includes two copies of the Ambassadorial Shuttle card and a third card printed with the relevant rules.
128152.name: Among the Stars: Ambassadorial Shuttle

128154.description:
From the publisher website:

A new and innovative games system for re-creating the epic battles around Kursk in 1943 on the Eastern Front.

These fast, fun and authentic-feeling rules, written by veteran games designer Warwick Kinrade (author of Kampfgruppe Normandie), are designed to play at 15mm and 20mm (1/72nd) scales.

Four detailed army lists included: German Panzer and Infantry Divisions, to face the Russian Tank Corps and Rifle Divisions across a series of scenarios or a short campaign "The Inglorious 12th July" for the savage tank battles at Prokhorovka.

Extensively researched background and comprehensive equipment data with a comprehensive modelling and painting guide section.
128154.name: Battlegroup Kursk

128156.name: Shotgun Jousting
128156.description:
Two gangs of bikers meet in the desert and after drinking themselves silly decide that jousting on their motorbikes, using shotguns rather than lances, is a good idea.

A two player push your luck game. Each player has 11 cards, and each selects and plays one card from their hand simultaneously until one or both players plays the "BLAM" card, which ends the round. The player playing the "BLAM" card scores for the cards they have already played this round. The game is played over four rounds.

128157.description:
The third installment of the Touhou Shisouroku, a re-theme of the popular Dominion card game.

This expansion features 16 new kingdom cards taken from Intrigue, Hinterlands, Prosperity and a few from other expansions.
128157.name: Touhou Shisouroku: Special Expansion Arc (EXTRA)

128158.description:
From the Rulebook:

The Space Fleet Patrol army book requires the Star Confrontation rules book in order to play. Space Fleet has highly trained Fleet officers that can deal with almost any situation and their ability to teleport around the battlefield means they will always be in the right place at the right time. Their advanced space shttles use their powerful pulsars to decimate the enemy.
128158.name: Star Confrontations: Space Fleet Patrol

128159.name: Tanktics
128159.description:
From the back of the box

As the hero of the hour, you need to use a huge hovering crane to create, assemble and control hoards of tanks to protect your base from The Evil Black Tanks.

You travel back through time to an age before they had established their iron grip, and then fight your way forward, destroying their influence in each era of history and ultimately, freeing the world from their tyranny forever.

Protect your Part-O-Matic while destroying their Receivers and roam the fully 3D landscape searching high and low for anything to recycle into a useful weapon - even poor fluffy innocent sheep!

128160.name: Charakternik: magią i mieczem
128160.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Charakternik to gra RPG w klimatach heroicznego dark fantasy wykorzystująca karcianą mechanikę Joker. W świecie Gan Eden, gdzie rozgrywa się akcja, ludzie walczą o przetrwanie, każdego dnia tocząc zwycięskie boje z potworami Szejtana – niegodziwego boga, który rękami ludzi szerzy zepsucie i zło.

and translation:

Charakternik is a dark fantasy, heroic RPG based on card-based system called Joker. In the world caleld Gan Eden, where the action takes place, humans fight for survival every day battling the forces of Szejtan - evil god, who uses humans to spread evilness and corruption.

128161.name: Zły: moc, władza, nieśmiertelność. First edition
128161.description:
user summary

Zły (eng. Evil One) is polish, web-published RPG that takes place in alternative 21st century with more advanced technology - mostly in the fields of quantum physics and biotechnology - and powerful occult forces. Also in the presence of devote and pious the power of the God is present. The game uses the Joker system.

128162.name: Zły: moc, władza, nieśmiertelność. Second edition
128162.description:
user summary

Zły (eng. Evil One) is polish, web-published RPG that takes place in alternative 21st century with more advanced technology - mostly in the fields of quantum physics and biotechnology - and powerful occult forces. Also in the presence of devote and pious the power of the God is present. The game uses the Joker system.

128163.name: Zły: moc, władza, nieśmiertelność. Second edition plus
128163.description:
user summary

Zły (eng. Evil One) is polish, web-published RPG that takes place in alternative 21st century with more advanced technology - mostly in the fields of quantum physics and biotechnology - and powerful occult forces. Also in the presence of devote and pious the power of the God is present. The game uses the Joker system.

This edition is also so called preview of third edition.

128164.name: Rush
128164.description:
A simple timed game where players name items in categories such as "Things you don't want to step on barefoot".
In turn, players draw a card, then read the category on the card and the amount of time out loud (from 5 to 15 seconds). The player then names as many things that fit the category as possible in the allotted time. The player gets one point for each named item.

After each player has three turns, the highest score wins.

128165.name: Counting Town
128165.description:
From the rule book:
"Counting Town is an engaging, imaginative and colourful play set that invites the child to do something very special: learn while playing."

The rule book provides 12 games for children to play. Each game is provided as a learning excercise for the children playing. The games focus on the language and number concepts such as colours, distance, time, quantity, sequencing etc.

All 12 games follow the same sequence of play:
The teacher setups the board for play.
A background story is provided for the game.
The teacher poses questions to the children based on the board setup.
The children then take turns based on the directions of the teacher (i.e. the teacher directs the children to move the parts around the board - the teacher then asks additional question to the children).

128166.name: Blister the Game
128166.description:
From the rule-book:

The object of all blistergames is to win by being the last player or team, with one or more active blisterpieces on the board.

The game is played with dice. There are two styles of dice: the blisterpieces (which have a different symbol on each die face) and the blisterblockers

The rule book provides six variations of the game: blisterboxes, blisterangles, blistercrosses, blistertriangles, blisterpokes and blisterballs.

Depending on the variation in play the blisterpieces are oriented such that they all have the same symbol showing. The symbol in play determines the movement that is allowed for that particular die (i.e. Blisterangles must move horizontally and vertically, Blisterpokes can move either horizontally or vertically).

The sequence of gameplay is as follows:
Player 1 rolls the 8-side die.
Player 1 moves one piece (die) the number rolled ensuring they follow the movement rules determined by the symbol on the die.
If the die ends its move within 6 squares with direct line of sight a "Blistermatch" may be started. During a Blistermatch the two dice being disputed is fought over. If one player can form the take-out pattern (identified in the rules) the losing die is eliminated. If a Blistermatch reaches a stalemate it ends and the game resumes as normal.
Gameplay continues with alternating turns until one player eliminates the other players pieces or a stale mate occurs.

128168.name: Temple of Lolth
128168.description:
Publisher blurb:
Deep in the Underdark Lolth's followers are stirring, praying to the Spider Queen, unwary travelers best be wary lest they find themselves on the sacrificial altar.

The map features numerous corners for adventurers to sneak around, small rooms to explore or even hide the bodies of cultists that stumble upon them, a prominent altar and magical summoning circle.

This high-quality vinyl surface is ideal for staging encounters during your adventures! The mat lies flat for ease of play and is sold in sturdy polycarbonate tube for easy storage and transport. The mat may be marked with WET-ERASE markers to temporarily alter terrain areas or make other notes about battlefield conditions during play. The Game Mat measure 20” x 30” and is marked with a 1” grid.

128169.name: Drow Sanctum
128169.description:
Publisher blurb:
The hidden lair of a Drow Cleric, a secret level under a Drow House, or even a distant cavern appropriated by a band of raiders, no-one wants to find themselves inside a Draw Sanctum without a few hardy friends and a some strong Dwarven steel in their hands.

The "Drow Sanctum" map features a central summoning circle, rooms for its inhabitants to rest and relax and plenty of other things for a curious adventurer to explore.

This high-quality vinyl surface is ideal for staging encounters during your adventures! The mat lies flat for ease of play and is sold in sturdy polycarbonate tube for easy storage and transport. The mat may be marked with WET-ERASE markers to temporarily alter terrain areas or make other notes about battlefield conditions during play. The Game Mat measure 20” x 30” and is marked with a 1” grid.

128170.name: Caverns of the Underdark
128170.description:
Publisher blurb:
The Underdark is an unforgiving place, noises are amplified, creatures skitter across the rocks, is it a small insect or an Umber Hulk! Only through careful exploration can you hope to find your treacherous environment!

This high-quality vinyl surface is ideal for staging encounters during your adventures! The mat lies flat for ease of play and is sold in sturdy polycarbonate tube for easy storage and transport. The mat may be marked with WET-ERASE markers to temporarily alter terrain areas or make other notes about battlefield conditions during play. The Game Mat measure 20” x 30” and is marked with a 1” grid.

Use with the Drow Sanctum or Temple of Lolth to further expand your adventures, or the Caverns of the Underdark 3D Adventure Set to bring new realism to your Underdark Explorations.

128171.name: Caverns of the Underdark: 3D Adventure Set
128171.description:
Publisher blurb:
Bring the shadowy reaches of the Underdark to your table! This set comes with 8 fully painted, resin stalagmite pieces. Paired with the brand new, matching Underdark game mate, you can bring new realism to your Underdark Explorations.

Can be used with the Caverns of the Underdark Vinyl Game Mat 20" x 30".

128172.name: The Magic Candle III
128172.description:
From the back of the box

The ancient lands around the Solian Sea have been stricken by a mysterious blight!

Crops are failing, illness is spreading, and strange beasts lurk in the hills and forests. Can your hero and his or her companions find its source? Can they discover a cure?

In The Magic Candle III, you will face monsters of the blight and other dangers of the Solian Lands. Design your own characters, then invite other friends to join the adventuring party.

Explore the home lands of the southern orcs, dwarves, elves, goblins and humans. Unearth valuable treasures. Learn exotic magic spells. But most importantly, stop the spreading blight before it consumes the entire world!

128174.description:
Gather your courage! The long-enjoyed peace of Yon has been disrupted by a ferocious and mean-spirited dragon — he's terrorizing the locals and eating their livestock without their permission! Fortunately, a few wannabe heroes (that's you!) have risen to the challenge of slaying the beast. Get yourself a brave companion, gather a powerful army, and enter the Dragon's Keep for cheese and country in Dragon Farkle!

To play, you gather an army of loyal soldiers or steal them from your opponents, hire suspicious-looking companions and gain allegedly useful items (most of which aren't even cursed), then fight that dragon you've heard so much about — or don't, if you hate winning...
128174.name: Dragon Farkle

128175.description:
Naruil Airfoil Championship is a steampunk airship racing game where players compete in a race of skill and madness. Each year a grand championship is held where teams from all over the realms come to put their skills to the test. The race begins with each team (player) receiving an old airfoil frame that will form the basis for their airship in the race.

The teams get four hours (turns) to fix up and prepare their ship for the race. When the time is up the teams must roll out their ship no matter the condition.. The race is on! The teams will race around the designated track, trying to stay ahead of the pack as they face challenges along the way. The airfoil that is the first to successfully cross the finish line, after the designated number of laps, wins. This is a rough race and you never know which racer, if any, will pull through in the end!
128175.name: Naruil Airfoil Championship

128177.name: Cabela's Ultimate Deer Hunt 2
128177.description:
Box Description:

"Deer, deer & more deer"

You asked for it, Cabela's delivers it!

In-Game Features Include:

-6 geographic regions
-Idaho: Whitetail Deer and Rocky Mountain Mule Deer
-Texas: Desert Mule Deer
-Washington: Whitetail Deer and Columbian Blacktail Deer
-Alaska: Sitka Deer
-Missouri: Whitetail Deer
-Michigan: Whitetail Deer

-6 firearms & 2 bows
-12-gauge
-.243
-.270
-.338
-.30-06
-Muzzle loader
-Recurve bow
-Compound bow
-All with great looks and realistic weapon recoil

-Authentic Cabela's Hunting Gear
-Variety of camouflage choices
-Binoculars
-Blinds (including tree stand)
-Cover scent
-Deer decoys
-GPS
-Compass
-Variety of deer calls
-Multiple ammo types
-Soft tip
-Different bullet weights and more!
-2-way radios
-Variety of scopes

-Animal movements feeding & responsiveness
-Game design based on actual DNR information

-Deep gameplay
-26 missions with increasing difficulty
-Quick Hunt when you need your fix as soon as possible

-And so much more we would need another box for all the options!

The hunting season has just begun! You can smell the crisp air blowing through the trees as you prepare for the Ultimate Deer Hunting experience, from the world's foremost outfitter... Cabela's!

Cabela's 2 not only has more deer per region, we flat out have the best graphics you've ever seen in a deer hunting game! Get ready to engage in "non-stop" deer action!

Travel to the frigid north and let the excitement begin. Rattle in and harvest a huge buck with one of 6 different firearm options. And to top it all off, authentic Cabela's gear!

128178.name: City Life
128178.description:
City Life continues the very long tradition of city-building and construction and management games, that was originally started by Utopia from developer Don Daglow and Will Wright's SimCity series by allowing the player to customize their urban city's roads, buildings, finances, ordinances and much more. City Life utilizes a three dimensional game engine in displaying cities, and also includes the requirement to satisfy six different socioeconomic groups within the city, an essential part of gameplay. The six groups include the Elites, Suits, Radical Chics, Fringe, Blue collars and Have-Nots.

Source: Wikipedia, "City Life 2008", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

128179.name: Legends Of Adventure
128179.description:
Box Description:

130 stunning scenes to discover & search!

Aladdin

Help find the enchanted lamp and charm the princess!

20,000 Leagues Under The Sea

Discover the beauty & danger that lie on the ocean floor!

The Three Musketeers

Return the 12 jewels to the Queen and save her honor!

Treasure Island

Search for the treasure of Captain Kidd!

Around The World In 80 Days

Travel the world in this epic hidden object adventure!

These 5 amazing games will whisk you away to all corners of the globe as you take part in some of the biggest Legends of Adventure!

A must-have for hidden object game enthusiasts!

128180.name: Farkle Flip
128180.description:
From the publisher's website and the rules:

Described as "the card-flipping, risk-taking game", this is a card game whereas the other Farkle games are all dice games. The aim is to score 10,000 or more points (although with 6 or more players you can decide to play to say 5,000 or 7,500).

There are 110 cards - 14 each of 1-6, 22 Farkles and 4 score summary cards. A score-keeper is chosen. Each player is dealt one card BUT all players can play off anyone else's cards. The rest of the deck is placed in the middle of the table and each player takes it in turn to draw one card from the deck then place it in front of himself or another player. The goal is to create combinations that score (eg three 1s = 300 points, three 6s = 600 points, six of any number = 3,000 points, five Farkles = 2,000 points and so on). If you create a winning combination you can either slide it to the centre of the table for potential scoring or leave it where it is to try and build a bigger score. You can stop drawing at any time and score any cards you've placed in the centre. However if at any time you draw a Farkle card you MUSt stop drawing, any cards in the centre can't be scored and become part of the face-up cards in front of you. You keep your Farkle card to one side and no other players may take it but you may use it to score later. Farkle cards are scored whenever their owner chooses and are then placed face down. There are some other interesting rules about play. If cards run out all face down cards are shuffled and a new centre deck formed. First to 10,000 (or the agreed total) wins!

The publisher places no limit on the number of players.

128181.name: SuperCross Circuit
128181.description:
Box Description:

Real tracks, real tricks, real riders, real racing!

-Jimmy Button is getting "loose"

-Battle the pack for the lead at 70 MPH

-Launching off the triple at Bank One Ballpark

-Ward and Lamson are dicing it out at Red Bud

-Doug Henry takes the outside line at Qualcomm

-Design 20 monster tracks with the Track Editor

-Accumulate cash to upgrade your bike

-From the makers of Cool Boarders 3

-Real 125cc, 250cc and 400cc bikes and equipment from top manufacturers

-15 crazy tricks like heel clickers and nac-nacs

-Bust huge air and sick stunts in free ride mode

-The top Pro riders including Albertyn, Dowd, Emig, LaRocco, Tortelli, Ward & Windham

-21 authentic supercross & motocross track plus 4 "local tracks"

128182.name: Tides Of War: Gettysburg
128182.description:
In honor of the 150th anniversary of the Battle of Gettysburg, military professionals, historians, and game designers created this game to closely replicate the actual battlefield conditions and operations of Gettysburg in 1863. The game comes in both a standard and collector’s edition and is played on an oversized game board with 172 miniature commanders and 126 brigade counters. The collector’s edition comes with life-like pewter miniatures on a magnetized metal game board for stability, and a carved wood base with drawers for storing the miniatures.
In lieu of the game’s dice and chart system, attacking and defending units can enter their strength, location, and orientation into the Interactive Game App (IGA) which then simulates the battle conditions to determine results. A unit’s strength is represented by possible Combat Factors on a brigade counter encircling a rotating miniature. The miniature is turned toward lower numbers as casualties are taken or is increased up to full strength as depleted units are merged into it. Reinforcement, Supply, and Morale Cards also affect the Combat Factor and randomness of game play.

The game also uses a Double Turn Rule where after the initial attack, both the attacker and defender may move all of their units one hexagon, defenders first. This allows both sides to retreat, stand, or bring up reinforcements during the turn. Units still in contact fight each other one more time before the turn ends. Artillery has a range of four hexagons and is only required to engage in battle if the enemy’s artillery is in range.

Incremental casualties, merging and resupplying units, and double-turn combat combine to recreate actual conditions, while the IGA cuts playing time in half. Tactical skill, not luck prevails, and the winner may rewrite history.

128183.name: The Wicked Willie Game
128183.description: This board game for adult on a hen do or in another party or good natured fun setting. Each player takes a coloured playing piece and works their way around the board's main track (red) and sub-tracks (childhood, adolescence, middle age and old age) until you reach the twilight zone. First to finish with a hand of 20 scores wins. Wicked cards have scenarios and give a score (which you collect) and Willie cards have scenarios and move you back/forth so many squares or to a set place on the board. Humour is integral to the game both on the board and the cards. Instructions are on the bottom of the box.

128184.name: Cluck 'n' Chuck
128184.description:
The game components are a chicken coop (which has a timer mechanism), 36 multi-coloured chickens and a die.

Chickens are tossed into the game box or a bowl and mixed up then each player takes 9 of varying colours. Each player lines up three of the nine in front of themselves. (It's best if possible to use 3 different colours.)

Play begins by one player pressing the coop down, which starts the timer. The aim is then for that player to as quickly as possible throw the die and if it matches the colour of a chicken in his row, throw that chicken quickly into the coop. Grab another chicken for the row of three and roll again until the die doesn't match any chicken in your row. You then pass the die to the first player on your left who does have a matching chicken and their turn begins.

When the coop jumps up and chickens go flying the player with the die must gather them and collect three. The rest go out of play. Play continues until one player gets rid of all their chickens.

128185.name: Don't Rock the Boat
128185.description:
A 3D boat and 2-piece water wave are assembled, and 16 pirate penguins are divided according to the number of players. The object is to balance your pirate penguins on the boat without making it tip. Players take it in turns to place their penguins standing up on the boat, wherever they wish. As soon as the boat rocks and one or more penguins fall over the game, or round, ends. The last player before the player who rocked the boat is the winner.

Recommended ages: 5-15 years

128186.description: Dahschur: Die Rote Pyramide - Die Privilegien des Pharao, a promotional item available at Spiel 2012, consists of four neutral marble tiles – one for each player. Players each have one tile and can use it during the game to extend the road or swap it for other items.
128186.name: Dahschur: Die Rote Pyramide – Die Privilegien des Pharao

128187.description: In the expansion Dahschur: Die Rote Pyramide - Der Felukenhändler, the Felukenhändler – feluccas merchant – is a seventh market stall added to the end of the market street. Each time a player moves one of his traders to this location, he can swap one of his already acquired gems. He can also earn additional points through this location.
128187.name: Dahschur: Die Rote Pyramide – Der Felukenhändler

128188.name: Helt hysteriskt
128188.description:
A crazy family/party-game.
Its a game to play when you want to have a real fun time with your buddies. The game includes that you need to do charades, answer questions with only yes or no and you also may get forced to do very silly stuff, like jump on one leg and sound like chicken every time its your turn.
When you do all this stuff you move a piece on a scoringtrack, the more your do right the more points, if you fail you loose points. If your reach the finnishline first you win.

128189.description:
Dragon Clash is a game of strategic combat between mighty dragons of legend and is set in a war-torn, modern-day world. After centuries of abuse from mankind, the dying spirit of Earth has called out to the dragons with hopes they’d help better humanity and reshape the world in elemental harmony. However, the destruction and violence that gave rise to their birth also tainted the dragons, driving them mad with a lust for war. Now the dragons not only battle humanity, but themselves. Ruthlessly hunting for the dragon eggs to satiate their endless hunger for power, the dragons wage an eternal struggle for dominance and the very soul of Earth.

In Dragon Clash, you are the dragon, hatching your beast from a variety of decks geared towards a specific breed and play style. The core set of Dragon Clash includes the Red Breather, Blue Adept, Silver Channeler, and Brown Mauler decks. Each deck of 72-cards includes a dragon and a variety of attacks unique to that deck’s theme.

To claim victory, your dragon must win the opponent’s Dragon Egg Card. You can do this by either forcing your opponent to discard his Dragon Egg or by consuming your opponent’s hoard with a Feast card, while a Dragon Egg is hidden there. Players take turns feeding their dragon’s hoard, aging from hatchling to elder wyrm, training a variety of attacks, and engaging in combat. Executing attacks, playing effects, and taking damage depletes your dragon’s Essence (the playing deck) and when a player’s dragon has exhausted all of their Essence, they must flee and lose the game.
128189.name: Dragon Clash

128190.name: Pusteblumen
128190.description:
Objective: gather most victory points by racing on & cleaning a meadow
- acting/moving by turn -
each player draws slides forming a meadow; according the number of blowballs your meeple may move forward - the further the higher the score; but if there isn't space enough to move players create environmental damage, too.
During the second phase players move back, cleaning up the waste they've generated. Due to mechanism removing all the trash they made (collecting garbage cards) you often have to choose an indirect way or even cooperate.

128191.name: Frog Prince
128191.description:
Aim of the game: The prince has been turned into a frog. Can you return him to his natural state by collecting kisses and the golden ball, and placing him on the right lily pad?

How it is played:

The central piece of the game is a clear plastic cylinder that has a disk inside. The disk shows the prince on one side, and a frog on the other. It is turned over via a magnetic mechanism: If the cylinder is put on the castle tile, it shows the frog. If it is put on the correct lily pad, the tile is turned over again and the prince reappears.

Players take turn spinning a spinner. The spinner has three different areas: One shows one "kiss" symbol (a pair of lips), the second shows two kisses, and the third one the golden ball. If the spinner points toward one of the kiss symbols, the active player gets the corresponding number of kiss tokens. If it points toward the golden ball, the active player gets the ball token (there is only one ball token, and it constantly changes its owner according to the spinner's results). A player can try rescuing the prince as soon as he/she has collected 3 kisses and the golden ball. To rescue the prince, the cylinder has to be put on the correct lily pad. But only one of the lily pads will make the prince reappear. If the player chooses the wrong lily pad, he/she loses their kiss tokens and has to start collecting new ones. If it is correct and the frog turns into a prince, that player wins the game.

128192.name: Run Right
128192.description:
User Summary

The only thing you need to do in this game - run. You run with creatures and vehicles, you have weapons and you shoot humans for gold. For that gold you can upgrade your stuff. And remember to run! It's apocalypse after all.

128195.name: Afrika
128195.description:
Objective: be the first getting rid of all your puzzle pieces
- acting by turns -
form a pile with hidden puzzle pieces;
yongest player or loser starts uncovering a piece, placing it upon the table & drawing another one in order to hand it over to left neighbour('s supply);
left neighbour acts in the same way; but if no tile can be placed it must be stored in his/her supply; in this case no tile may be handed over to left neighbour, too.
After pile is empty each play may place 2 tiles out of own supply - by turns.


remarks:
belongs to series: Mosaik "Raum und Grenze"

128196.name: Hadak útja
128196.description:
(English)

Hadak útja, or Crossroad of Peoples is a light wargame in the footsteps of the famous Britannia. The game covers the history of the Carpathian Basin from the Roman conquest (12 BC) to the arrival of the Hungarians (907 AD). Players control mighty invading armies - from the glorious Romans and the ferocius Germanic tribes to the dreaded Huns and the peaceful Slavs - that seek to carve a new home on the blood-soaked soil under the Carpathians.

The players move and fight battles with their units in order to occupy and keep given areas. Units include four types of combat units (normal and heavy infantry, normal and heavy cavalry), settlements (oppida and Roman cities) and leaders (e.g. Emperor Trajan, King Attila the Hun or Prince Svatopluk of Moravia). At the end of the turn each people on the map score VPs from their occupied areas.

The game includes a Simple and an Advanced Game. All files will be made available in English as well.

(magyar)

A Hadak útja egy történelmi társasjáték, amely a híres Britannia című játék nyomdokain a Kárpát-medence küzdelmes múltját mutatja be a római hódítástól (Kr. e. 12.) a magyar honfoglalásig (Kr. u. 907). A játékosok azokat a hódító népeket irányítják - a dicső rómaiaktól és a vad germánoktól a rettegett hunokig és a békés szlávokig -, akik új hazát kerestek a Kárpátok övezte véráztatta síkon.

A játékosok célja, hogy egységeikkel mozogva és csatázva bizonyos területeket foglaljanak el és tartsanak meg. A játékban négyféle harci egység (normál- és nehézgyalogos, normál- és nehézlovas), települések (oppidumok és római városok), illetve vezérek (pl. Traianus császár, Attila hun király vagy Szvatopluk morva fejedelem) kapott helyet. A térképen levő népek a fordulók végén pontokat kapnak az általuk elfoglalt területek után.

A játéknak egy Kezdő és egy Haladó változata is van. Minden szükséges kellék letölthető (lesz) innen.

128197.name: Fear & Greed: The Stock Market Card Game
128197.description:
In Fear & Greed: The Stock Market Card Game, each player is given $10,000 to invest in eight different stock options. Twelve "Fear & Greed" cards are dealt out, simulating a year in the market. The first round is automatically a Buying rush. All players, starting with the Banker, buy stock – 100/shares Min 400/shares Maximum. Once all players have bought, the player to the Banker's left becomes the Broker. The Broker flips a new Stock Market Value card, picks a "Fear & Greed" card in hand and reads it; all other players Buy or Sell on the basis of the card. Each card is color-coded and if it matches stock in a player's portfolio, follow what the card says. Forced actions always take your turn, then the next player becomes The Broker.

When all cards have been played, flip over one last Stock Market Value card and cash out all remaining shares at the new rates. The player with the most equity wins!

128198.name: Godlike (revised edition)
128198.description:
From the back of the book:

You are larger than life. But the war is larger than you....

In the beginning, there was only one. He flew into the Berlin Olympics of 1936 to light the torch, then landed beside Hitler to proclaim the triumph of the Aryan will.

By the end of the war, there were two hundred thousand of them. They came from Poland, from Finland, from England, and from France. They came from besieged villages and from the halls of academia, from the devastation of Stalingrad and from the corn fields of Kansas.

Their powers were both great and small, and they died by the thousands for the sake of the people they loved.

This is their story....

Godlike is a superhero roleplaying game unlike any other.

No bright spandex, no pulp machismo. In the face of a world on fire, ordinary men and women emerge who possess the talents their times demand - but who are still as vulnerable, and eventually as expendable, as the troops in the foxholes. You can be faster than a speeding bullet, as long as you don't step on a landmine. Backed by an extensive historical timeline, players take the roles of Talents committed to the greatest challenge of the twentieth century. Possessed of powers you barely understand and struggle to control, you fight the forces of darkness both within and without - for defeat is a state of mind, and if you lose faith in yourself, you will never become Godlike.

This rulebook includes:

- An entire timeline of the war, covering the years 1936-1946 in detail

- More than sixty dossiers of Axis and Allied Talents

- More than forty Talent powers, as well as the rules necessary to create your own powers

- A "field manual" covering more than 200 weapons and vehicles from all sides of the conflict

- An innovative dice-pool mechanic - a single combat roll determines initiative, success, damage, and hit location

- Options for different play styles - such as high realism, cinematic, or four-color - and the rules tweaks to run them

- A complete campaign background

- And an open-source rules conversion for game systems that use a standard twenty-sided die

128199.name: Liliput
128199.description:
A children's game themed on Jonathan Swifts "Gulliver's Travels", specifically on Gulliver's encounter with the Lilliputians.

Each player is head of a Lilliputian family clan, consisting of four members. The aim of the game is to tie down the sleeping Gulliver while gaining as few points as possible. Players take turns taking one of the Lilliputian figures, each of which has either a number from 0 to 5 or a rope symbol on its base (not visible when players choose which figure to take). The active player announces the figure's value and decides if they want to put it on their own family card or return it. If a rope symbol is drawn, the player must exchange two of their family members (they may choose to exchange for a member of a different family clan), announce the new values and tie Gulliver down on one arm or leg. A Lilliputian with a rope symbol is worth ten points.
The game ends when Gulliver has been tied down in all four places. The player whose family clan has the lowest total value (all family members added together) wins the game.

128200.name: Zenerchi
128200.description:
User Summary:

Zenerchi is a match three game that takes the shape of concentric circles made up of different colored section. Players rotate circles to create matching columns of three or more and those sections disappear. Play continues until players fill the center circle by destroying sections of the required colors or time runs out.

128201.description:
A simple die-based racing game for children.

A big walrus is trying to scare away penguins from their ice floes. Can your penguin still manage to reach the iceberg?

Each player has a penguin player's piece. Players move their penguin according to the roll of the die from one ice floe to the next. If a walrus symbol is rolled, the walrus comes down from the iceberg, pushes the closest penguin off the floe and makes it fall back a few spaces (penguins that have fallen off an ice floe are moved back to the next of the darker floes). The player who has rolled the walrus can choose where to place it.

The player whose penguin reaches the iceberg first wins the game.
128201.name: Pinguin Rallye

128202.name: Das Buch & das Leben
128202.description:
A communicative card game in which quotations from the bible have to be put in relation to other texts. The idea behind the game is to show that the bible is still relevant today, to personal life as well as to society and politics.

The game consists of two different sets of cards. One contains quotations from the bible, the other descriptions and aspects of modern life in the form of short texts, messages, promotional slogans etc.

The players have to connect the quotations from the bible on the cards in their hands with the cards from the second set. This doesn't necessarily have to be a literal connection, it involves interpretation and translation into different contexts.
Each player has a hand of five cards with a quotation from the bible, of which he/she has to choose one to go with the current card from the second set of cards. Each player then has one minute to explain why they have chosen a particular quotation, with the aim of "selling" their choice to the other players. The players then vote on the "best" (i.e. most fitting) quotation. Each round, a different player is the "buyer". He/she uses a set of blue chips numbered 1-5 to secretly vote which quotation they consider best, second best etc. The other players use white chips (also numbered 1-5) to guess the buyer's preferences. Players get points for choosing good (i.e. rated highly by the buyer) quotations as well as for guessing the buyer's preferences.
The game ends either after a certain number of rounds, or after a player has reached a certain number of points. The player with the most points wins.

128203.name: Paradise
128203.description:
The object of the game is to go on a journey round and round any of the four circular routes and collect five picture cards from each of the wildlife, people, flowers, places and birds symbols.

Players roll the die and move, landing on a symbol and collecting a picture. Sometimes the picture has instructions to move ahead or back, so a player's turn isn't over until no more movements are directed. After five of one symbol have been collected, a player is penalized cowrie shells for every future landing on that same symbol.

The winner is the player who collects 25 cards and has the highest number of cowrie shells left (thus a player collecting 25 cards first is not necessarily the winner).

128204.description:
Ars Victor is a fast-paced, tense, two-player boardgame of tactical combat. You command a furious fighting force OF THE FUTURE against a ferocious foe. Recruit your armies. Scout out a unique map. Draw a hand of Command Cards. Deploy your Vanguard. The battle is joined!

To win, you must reduce your enemy’s Glory to zero before they do the same to you. Your successes on the battlefield chip away at your enemy’s Glory. It never goes up, only down; so it’s always a tense, back-and-forth race to the bottom.

Your turn is simple: play a Command Card to activate one or more of your units. Move them across the battlefield, and try to slaughter the enemy. In the process, try to hold on to the three Capture Points in the middle of the board, and keep your Headquarters alive.

Combat is resolved in a single roll of multiple colored dice. Dice quantity and color can be affected by terrain, as well as unit Special Abilities. Simple icons on the dice show the results.
128204.name: Ars Victor
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 53 To The Ars Victor Goes The Spoils After 6 Takes

128205.name: Blockids
128205.description:
From the back of the North American game case

Today you're going over the wall... but how far you go from there is up to you! Choose one of eight cartoon characters and bounce, blast, and batter your way past an array of formidable, fortress-like block barriers in Natsume's revolutionary 3-D twist on an arcade classic. Score points and unlock a special power that unleashes incredible block busting capabilities! The blocks are stacked against you. How long will you last?

-Play in immersive 3-D! Bounce balls over obstacles!
-Save your Adventure mode progress and high scores on Memory Card!

128206.name: Donkey Derby
128206.description:
Donkey Derby uses something like a roulette wheel for players to win letters which they use to make words. There are four versions of the game based on the word list from which the players are trying to form the words. There is a "Beginers Game", a "Bird Game", an "Animal Game" and a "Capital City Game".

The color for each player is determined each game by lot. When 2 or 3 players are playinging each player gets 2 letter cards (or a special Donkey card) on each spin. If four players are playing there is a twist. The Yellow player gets one letter by spin and also gets to take any letter he wants from the bank. For five players the black player gets one letter plus he can "rob" any player of a letter not in a word.

The game is played for points. 400 points is recommended for 2-4 players, and 500 points for 5 players. The donkey cards are worth points or can be traded back to the bank for three letter cards.

128207.name: 100 Wacky Things you have to do while playing this game
128207.description:
The game is based around 96 Wacky cards - each with a wacky thing to do, a point value 1-12 and some with either 'Always' or 'Whenever' written on. There are also 4 prop cards and 4 props - funny glasses, a feather boa, an echo microphone and an elephant nose - with detailed instruction on what to do if you have one of these cards.

The 4 youngest players randomly pick a prop card then take that prop. Wacky cards are shuffled and placed facedown within reach of all. On your turn take a Wacky card, place it face up in front of you and read it aloud to all players. You then do the wacky thing - and if it's marked as an Always card you repeat it every turn; if it's marked as a Whenever card it will be whenever someone else does a particular thing.

The object is to be the player who gets the most points for doing wacky things over an agreed number of rounds. Add up the points on each player's cards - highest points wins.

128208.name: Holy Diver
128208.description:
User Description

Holy Diver was an NES exclusive side-scrolling action-adventure game. It has a magic theme and was only released in Japan.

128209.name: B-Wings
128209.description:
User Description

B-Wings is a top-down space-themed shooter which plays similarly to Galaga and 1942. You choose a booster weapon attachment which gives you extra firepower and you have to use your weapons to create a path to fly through.

128210.name: DMP Afrika Korps
